This is a little pricey than other sushi joints but where else can you find sushi this good past 10?
author: Derwei C.

description: It's not Japanese. Surely it once was, but it's not now. None of the staff are Japanese nor speak the language. They've memorized "irasshaimase" and "arigatou" and that's it. They don't even care. We ordered an appetizer (chicken karaage) as well as chirashi. They brought out the chirashi unrealistically quick, then the karaage appetizer well after. Then they had the gall to stop by and say "How is everything?" We objectively said, well, the appetizer shouldn't come after the chirashi. They made excuses as to how it's so haaaard when they're so busy. Sad violin. Well what's also hard is justifying $100 for this....
author: Clare H.

description:
We were there at 10:30-11pm on a Wednesday night and there was a 30 minute wait! That's how popular this place is!

The sushi was fresh & delicious. The wait staff was courteous, although they were rushing around quite a bit. 

Because you step down about 10-15 steps into the restaurant, it felt a bit stuffy & warm even though it was cold outside.
author: Fatemeh S.

description:
Went on a Saturday night after spending all day sightseeing and shopping with my wife. Truly a restaurant that we most likely wouldn't have walked into.... Thank goodness for Yelp.

Had sashimi (yellowtail, barracuda and salmon) and it was excellent. I especially recommend the Barracuda as it was fantastic.

The rolls were good but nothing out of this world. I caution anyone against ordering a cocktail as they are easily the smallest I have ever seen and not cheap either. I suggest you have Sake or Kirin and skip the cocktail.

Service was fast, prompt and friendly.
author: Tony U.

description: Just ate here tonight and now we both have a stomach ache. I hope they flash freeze their sushi and our nausea will go away by tomorrow.  Never have I gotten sick from eating sushi in San Francisco, not even sushi from the mall.  Even if we didn't get sick, their sushi are skimpy, overpriced and very average. The menu I touched was smelly. I have no idea why there is a line out the door. Our waiter was nice though, and there is a young vibe, but we will not return because we got sick!  Sometimes I feel like SF hipsters just don't know how to eat.
author: Apple M.

description:
Long wait ... but we were warned so can't complain.
Lively atmosphere - young crowd. Service was good for the most part although we asked a random waitstaff for low sodium soy sauce and it never came.
Food was mediocre to good and or different and presentation was different. Nigiri was made up of fish on rice balls the size of kidney beans - no exaggeration. They must have been low on rice. My husbands chirashi had  barely 1/2 cup sushi rice in it. 
Fish was strange- his chirashi consisted of maybe 20 pieces of fish of various sizes from 1/4 inch to 2 inches all mixed together in bowl. Chirashi means " scattered " but this was a little extreme.
I had several orders of nigiri sushi- the salmon toro was the best I have ever had. Unfortunately there selection of fish was extremely limited- they did not even have hirame.
Loved the salmon (and I only ordered it because there was a limited selection of fish) that's for sure!
author: francesca g.

description: Its not the best sushi in San Francisco, Its a bit on the pricey side, portions can be on the small side,  there's usually a long wait and no place to wait except the on the stairs, and its small and crowded inside; but the atmosphere is great, usually a DJ spinning tunes, everybody's enjoying themselves, and they have a good selection of sushi, rolls, dishes, and booze.  I always pop into here when I'm in town and never regret it.
author: Michael B.

description: Not a fan of the wait or "waiting area" on the stairway but there are plenty of bars around to kill time, and we headed to the owl tree across the street! The sexy tuna I ordered was awesome, kind of like the lion king roll everywhere else, and the salmon skin roll was pretty bomb too! We added some fun to the dinner with some sake bombs :)
author: Natalie F.

description:
I have been to Ryokos a couple of times and I love it!

I love the ambiance, I love the food, I love the staff and I love how affordable it is.

Granted, there is always a long wait, but I am happy to wait sipping on some beer while catching up with friends.

Seafood here is always fresh and tasty. This last time we tried some fried octopus, and was truly amazing...that plus a lot of sushi made of our Friday night a great night!

I love how this place feels very underground, yet right in the middle of the city. They often have a DJ playing music, so even if you have to wait long you can enjoy of the fun music that is playing inside.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: Outstanding sushi!  Chefs are fun and yell funny things at Patrons.  It is old, a bit dirty and loud.  I would rather have good sushi verses stellar atmosphere.
author: Brent H.

description:
Negatives: the hour wait with nowhere to sit, the hour it took to get our food even when the waitress kept apologizing, and the okay food.

Positives: the staff offering water as we were waiting to get seated, the free order of Mochi for the long wait (even though it was such a small amount for 6 people), the late night hours, and the great old school beats playing all night.
author: Joleen Q.

description:
Ok, seriously this is probably one of the coolest sushi places in SF.  Why?  Because who else has a DJ spinning while you eat dinner!?!  Kendrick Lamar!?  I mean...  

Hmm... but the place is kind of small.  It was crowded when I got there.  Probably around 11PM and had to wait about 30MIN. but it's fine I guess.  Sat at the bar and was satisfied with all the nigiri's and rolls.  Everything was going good until we asked for the check and waited over 20MIN?  We pretty much asked 2-3 waitresses.  Ya, idk about that part.  I was getting super annoyed... I'm a patient person but really!?!  

I would've given this place an extra star but boo to the waitresses.
author: Criselle O.

description:
I'm really not sure why this place has 1500+ reviews and 4 stars...is everyone drunk when they have their sushi??

I read a few bad reviews on Yelp before coming here but didn't think anything of it since there were so many great reviews. If you are reading this review now and debating if you should go...DON'T GO.

The rolls are overpriced and so small!! For example, the volcano roll that everyone raved about was $13 and only came with 5 pieces.... And why would anyone pay $20 for a rainbow roll??

Overall, I thought this place was a waste of money!! The only reason I'm giving it 2 stars instead of 1 is because the fish was fresh at least. I can understand why some people would like this place because of the fun underground vibe, but if you're trying to find a good sushi place-this is not the place!! You can get way better sushi for a much better price anywhere else in the city. I would not recommend coming here unless you are drunk and craving sushi after midnight.
author: Julia H.

description:
The sushi itself is pretty decent, wasn't overly impressed compared to what all the five star reviews were calling out. I would say it is on par for the price they are charging. $15 for a pitcher of Asahi was the best bargain for the evening by far. 

The interior is pretty unique for SF. Very dim, underground with lounge music playing in the background. Had more of  NY feeling than anything else. Lots of couples there on dates dressed like they were going out afterwards, which is a nice change from the typical dressed-down attire of most every other place in the city.

The waiting list is a royal pain tho. Having to get there and wait for 45 minutes before you want to eat is annoying enough, but then after seeing people that showed up after us being seated already we went to check. They told us they had called our party twice already, even tho we had been waiting in the restaurant next to the hostess. The food was good, but not something I'd want to wait through their seating process again for.
author: Michael S.

description:
I really don't know how to rate this, but I have a split decision between the food and the service: 

Food: 4 
Service: 0 (On behalf of a friend) 

I came here with a couple of friends of mine for our friend's wife's birthday dinner. This spot was kinda hard to find with my GPS system and passed it up a couple of times. As we got the the entrance, there was a stairway that lead to a basement like area. I felt like I was entering and illegal gambling / fight event. this place was busy since there were people waiting to be seated. There was a DJ spinning some music to liven up the restaurant. Luckily for us, our party arrived before us and walked to the secluded back room. 

The ambiance in the back room was lit with very little light and cramped for our party. The majority of us had to use our cell phones as flashlights to move around. Our server Eddie was a cool guy. So for dinner I was recommended by a fellow Yelper to try the Chirasi dinner, but instead I went for the Sashimi dinner. (Next time Viennelyn I'll give it a try ;)). To also celebrate the occasion, I ordered a round of sake for the whole table. The sake went down rather smoothly. 

On to the dinner. The Shasimi dinner that I order was very fresh. It had been a while since I've had Shasimi. After taking a couple bites of my Shasimi, now I was craving for Poke (Hawaiian Shasimi). 

As for my friend's servicing rating, here is the story. My friend was ordering Katsu for his dinner. Our server mentioned to my friend that they had a "Special Katsu" for the evening. So my friend order the special. When everyone in our party received our orders, my friend was the only one without his food. Almost 30 mins into our dinner, we were all done with our platters except my friend. He never got his dinner. As our waiter came to clear our table he comes and tells my friend that they were out of the Special. 

I know inside he was heated. So as hungry as he was, he got the regular Kastu and ate his dinner by himself. There was no apology for the mishap. Or any kinda of comp for his meal for the error by the restaurant staff. As for coming here again, only when I'm in the area. For my friend, that's a negative.
author: Jay G.

description: Just visiting and was looking for a great sushi spot. It definitely did not disappoint! There was a wait, however, and more and more people kept pouring in, so I worried about the service not being able to manage the crowd. But, I was very impressed at their ability to attend to the service and the sushi was fantastic!
author: Kim F.

description: We came here around 6pm on Monday it was super pack,luckily we got the seat right away. First We ordered the Ankimo, Fresh Oysters and Hamachi Kama for the appetizer it was super tasty. And we decided to try the specials on the board, we ordered Toro,hamachi,tako.....etc it was a wonderful dinner I have ever had, everything just prefect but one thing I don't really enjoy it was the service, I have to asked the waitress to refill my hot tea every single time made me felt annoying, but anyways overall I definitely gonna return again :)
author: Kevin K.

description:
Initially, it was a bit nerve wracking to confront the basement entrance thumping with drum & bass music. It had a creepy uncle's "HEY COME DOWN THE CELLAH, I HAVE A FREEZER FULL OF POPSICLES FOR YOU (wink)" type of vibe. 

Thankfully, getting me to eat sushi is as easy as selling Rick James some crack. Even better, my uncle and I aren't that tight anyway. I'm 2 for 2!

With over 1,100 Yelp reviews, and features in places such as the Fine Living Network and New York Magazine, Ryoko had a lot to live up to, and for the most part, it delivers.

The restaurant has been around for a couple of decades, which is on par with how experienced their chefs were. One of the guys we chatted up had been with Ryoko for over 11 years. Yowza. On top of that, the sushi I had was amongst  the freshest I've tried on the West Coast. It's hard to quantify freshness, but the fish had just the right textures and temperatures. Try the Jumping Tuna and Hamachi if you're new.

I even began to enjoy the music. I swear, listening to Tetris in dubstep aids with digestion. My only knock was our party's 30-minute wait, only to be offered to sit on an ottoman and wedging myself between our table and large piano. Yes, a grand piano. Makes sense to put in a room as large as a sauna. If these guys play Tetris again, it should be with the dining layout.

Word to the wise: If you see a long line out the door and have a party of 3 or more, it's probably a good idea to jet. Just pretend your creepy uncle was offering you some creamsicles. I don't care what anyone says, he's not supposed to love you *that* much.
author: Johnny T.

description:
I would definitely go here for the environment if you're having dinner before a night on the town. Music is loud, people are having a blast. 

Nigiri eaters: just isn't that good. The fish was a bit dry, the portions EXTREMELY small (relative to other higher quality sushi places), and so on. 

Roll eaters: if you're more on board with the cream cheese stuffed spicy tuna roll with hot sauce on top (or similar), it's really not all that bad and you may not notice much difference from other spots, other than the smaller sized rolls. 

Wait time: I was by myself so I slipped right in with no wait, but other people covered the stairs and out onto the street. My previous visit with a guest was nearly an hour wait. All in all, normal for sushi on a Saturday in SF I suppose.
author: Frankie S.

description: Stumbled upon this place after having some drinks at a nearby bar. The entrance isnt exactly welcoming but the food us unbelievable. We got to the sushi bar around midnight and got a table a couple minutes later. The food came quick and was delicious! This place is definitely a hidden gem
author: Esther K.

description:
Very spectacular rolls! I got here just before the line got long so there was a short wait to get in (it gets insanely busy even on a weekday dinner night, so try to get here by 630 to beat the crowd!)

Ryoko is a little affordable and the quality is amazing. I love the moody interior and bustle. The rolls were well-crafted, the fish was good, and the restaurant sure was busy!
author: Kathy Z.

description: I've been to Ryoko a dozen times, there's always a long line if you go past 7, so it's best to try and get a table around 6:30-6:45pm.  The sushi has always been good but I can't say it's exceptional.  I really like their miso soup with clams, it's one of the few places where you can get that in the city.
author: Alex T.

description:
I've been to my fair share of sushi restaurants. From sushi buffets to your regular hole in the wall, and I have to say that this place has the freshest tasting fish. The rice was flavorful and not your normal sushi rice-- Not too tart or grainy.  
Although there is always a wait, they moves quickly.  Definitely my favorite sushi spot now!
author: Noey A.

description:
This is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in the city.  I've been here several times and the sushi has always been super fresh and delicious.  I've traveled throughout Japan, and I've eaten at the best sushi restaurants in LA, and while San Francisco sushi is not LA sushi, Ryoko is still pretty damn good.  The service isn't amazing, but they are always super busy, so that's understandable.

Everything on the specials menu is a good bet.  The last time I was here, I had the fried baby octopus appetizer, which was fantastic.

I always get the toro, sweet shrimp, and scallop sushi.  The rolls are good, but nothing memorable, so next time I'll just stick to the sushi.

Tip: Get here right when they open at 6:00PM to avoid the long wait.
author: Grace C.

description:
If you're a serious sushi lover like me, don't come to this place!!!

Decor 1 out of 5
Service 1.5 out of 5
Food 2 out of 5

The place is like a creepy karaoke bar inside a basement, not a proper atmosphere to eat  authentic sushi. 

Arrived around 8pm Wednesday, we waited for more than 1hr. The system is disorganized, the hostess is also a waitress. If there is an open table and she is taking care of other tables, you will need to wait at least 10 more mins before she realizes the table is available. If you have a long line everyday, get a dedicated hostess!!! 

Our waitress(not that hostess) was very friendly, but the service was kind of slow. 

We only ordered nigiri, their fish was fresh, that's why I gave them two stars.
The chef's technique was ok, but the portion of the sushi rice was way off. First, you can hardly taste the fragrance of sushi rice, second I can't feel the satisfaction of my mouth by eating the undersized nigiri.
Their uni was fresh, but also expensive,14.80 for two pieces!!!! I don't know where does the uni come from. I've tried uni from Hokkaido and santa barbara, none of them are that expensive. Plus the seaweed was soggy!!!!　
About the on house Edamame, it was cold, like they got it from costco's fridge.
The soy sauce was so salty, even with me who has high tolerance.
They fried amaebi's head without clean the gut properly, you can see the black stuff after they fried and it didn't taste good.

I don't understand all the good reviews, this place is so overrated. All in all, the food doesn't worth the wait, I won't come back. :(
author: Eric L.

description:
Ahhh. Pretty close to a full satisfaction. Just a preamble: we went there and the wait was more than an hour. We put our names on the list, walked to another place, had sushi, and on the way back we just decided to swing by to taste some fish here if our name was still on the list. And as soon as we walked downstairs our name was called and we sat at the bar. 

Was that a lucky moment! The chef's special pieces were so delicious. Even the fried Unagi skeleton was just so awesome. I cannot tell how excited I was with every dish that arrived. Thanks for the food!
author: Sinan G.

description: Awesome place! I love that they're open until 2:00am. The sushi and the fried chicken were delicious. The white peach saketini and the Tokyo tea cocktail were good too.
author: Emilia B.

description: Top 5 sushi spots in San Francisco. It's a hidden restaurant, you have to go down a set of stairs to eat but it's always crowded (which is a good sign) so get there early. If you have some time to kill, go next door to Fino and get yourself a caprese salad and drink.
author: Samara C.

description: One of the best Japanese restaurant at San Francisco! Beef teriyaki is very good. And uni is very fresh!
author: Wendy W.

description: I have had better. The wait to get in is always super long so i thought it would be great. Its different, they put peanut butter in one of their sushi rolls, and met craft cheese on another one. I am not a huge fan and probably will not go back.
author: Benjamin L.

description:
Sushi is great and cooks are super friendly (if you sit at the bar they'll check on you, it's not their job they just do it because they are awesome). Also there is frequently a DJ for late night, not sure why but who cares it's fun! (Don't worry it's mellow tunes, no EDM when you're trying to have a nice meal.)

The only thing that prevented the 5-star rating is the hostess. She seems inexperienced in the service industry, she was rude and sassy to my group of friendly guests as well as everyone I saw in front of us. 

Also beware that you will have difficulty getting seated if you don't personally go add your name to the list because she will likely not ask you (assuming you're not a first time customer). This complaint is again not with the restaurant but with this one staff member individually. Overall a cool underground spot with above average quality sushi at below average prices.
author: Joseph W.

description:
This is one of the best Sushi joints I have been to in my life. 

The Sushi is phenomenal, the ambiance is the most authentic I've experienced.

The wait is extremely long and the staff is on par.

I'd recommend!
author: Taylor D.

description:
This place was great up until the end of the night! I would go 3.5 stars, but will round down since everyone here seems to round up.

Free edamame - tasted typical, but awesome for free!
Nigiri - delicious - done very well. Had the hamachi, hotate, o-toro ($18/order) and something else that I don't remember. All good though.
Spider roll - they call it a crab crunch or something like that. It was very good.
My buddy had the sashimi assortment. Also awesome. Nice thick cuts of very decent quality fish.

The most expensive roll, whatever it was - baked some shit. It was disgusting. Melted/slightly burnt processed cheese on salmon with avocado and imitation crab inside. Hideous. We ate only 2 pieces. I wish I had sent it back.

Green tea ice cream - also disgusting. Flavorless. Tasted like butter. Not sweet, not tea bitter. Disgusting.
author: Alton Y.

description: I came here with a friend around 6:30 pm on a Thursday night and did not have to wait at all. We got two spots right at the bar and the food was served quick. Delicious delicious fish. Highly recommend the otoro ( tuna belly sashimi). The best piece of fish I have ever had in my life. It is pricy but one piece worth a try, and leave it to the end so you do not feel everything else you eat after that is inadequate. Mochi ice cream and banana split ice cream are both really top-notch. Great ambience, fast service, delicious food. I definitely come back again
author: Ngan P.

description: My boyfriend & I wanted something walkable from our hotel so we decided to yelp something nearby and we stumbled across the gem! It's a great little hole in the wall restaurant where you would probably walk right past it but I'm so glad we went in! Their sashimi is one of the best that I have ever had! It was so fresh that it tasted like the just caught it that morning. The staff was amazing and our server was super attentive to our table. All the sushi rolls we ordered were all delicious!
author: Jenn T.

description:
So... 2 stars are for the good sushi, BUT, after taking our order the waitress (accidentally) BROKE my iPhone, totally smashed it.
Now, it's not like she did it on purpose, and she really felt bad, but the feeling that I had as a customer was not better, and the service was pretty poor in that concern.

Not even desert. No discount. And a broken iPhone.  

After 30 min of waiting in line to eat there - disappointment. After all- the customer experience is all that matters, here's a proof.
author: Ayelet M.

description: The quality of the sushi is very good. A bit expensive though. The Sayori ($14 for two pieces of nigiri) is a rare treat.
author: Daniel L.

description:
Ryoko's probably doesn't need another review, but we got here thanks to Yelp (and the really helpful guy at Flax - the art store), so it's only fair we give back. 

Sign up on the clip board and get on the waiting list as soon as you enter. 

The fish was f.a.n.t.a.s.t.i.c! We had the chef's selection sashimi plate, which comes with spicy roe, tako something (octopus and seaweed with a tangy vinaigrette) and beef oroshi. Everything was fresh and had just the right amount of 'sea' in it. The line's long, but the food's completely worth the wait.
author: Aditi C.

description:
Came here on Valentine's Day weekend with my boyfriend and we LOVED it. I have been to Ryoko once before this. We wanted something casual and to also have FRESH fish. Well, this place is it!!!!!

BEWARE: There is always a line. You won't get seated if you come late. This restaurant is underground and totally hip. What sucks is they don't take rezzys. Thus, I recommend you walk here and wait outside 10 mins before it opens. Then you will be guaranteed a spot when the restaurant opens. :)

We waited outside in line for 10 mins before it opened and were immediately seated when the restaurant opened. 

Atmosphere: The sushi chefs warmly yell at you in Japanese welcoming you. Its very cute and welcoming. Overall, this place is loud and has TVs everywhere. I also think people just talk loud here and since its underground, the sound is kept well within the restaurant.

Food and Drinks: Their rolls are fantastic. I think we got a dragon roll and rainbow roll. You should also ask for the special. They always have something special, whether its from Santa Barbra or Japan-- your pick, its all very fresh. Since it was Valentine's Day weekend, my boyfriend and I also got drinks to celebrate. And boy, were those drinks strong! I got a peach mojito. At first sip, it tasted so strong ( which is why I got drunk later) but I realized  you have to stir the drink.... Other than that, the drink was great. In addition, I think we also got their Japanese chicken wings, which were crispy, hot and tasty. SO GOOD I LOVE IT.

This place is awesome. Too bad I can't come here after work because I don't end work early enough to wait outside for 10 mins. Other than that, come on a weekend and enjoy a lively vibe and solid, fresh sushi!
author: Eileen W.

description: First stop in SF. Found it on Yelp (thanks). Still eating as I write this. Everything on the menu is top. Drinks cold and tasty. The DJ is amazing. Proper tunes for a proper atmosphere. I don't need earplugs, but I can't stop dancing in my chair. First tip was to the DJ. Food is excellent. The chefs and service staff will be tipped appropriately, above excellent.
author: Shirley Q.

description:
This place seems to be known for their cheap rolls but with a small price comes with small portions. 

Our group decided not to order the sashimi/Nigiri die to its higher than average price. I'm more into authentic style Nigiri sushi so I have a bias against rolls.

anyways this place seems to cater to a crowd that enjoys Americanized sushi with their rolls not showcasing the flavor of the fish and letting all the other flavors that make their rolls unique do the heavy lifting. 

I would recommend this place to people who are afraid to dive in to sushi and find it too exotic. The rolls here remind you of familiar flavors while adding just a bit of exotic flavors. So if you are new to sushi but don't wanna jump in go authentic getting a mouthful of intense fish flavors try this place first. 

of their rolls I think the pokemon stood out well for me showcasing the fish flavor and complimenting it's savory flavor with the sweetness of the mango. 

people are saying the fish here is really fresh and maybe I should come back again and try the Nigiri even though it's on the pricier side but not too pricy with a salmon Nigiri at $6. 

All in all i feel their rolls need to be more unique.  it has its staple rolls all other sushi bars have and a some unique but not very complicated rolls that won't really blow your mind.
author: Myk S.

description:
Yes, there are things not to love: long waits, generally banal DJ club music/bro dubstep, a decent percentage of obnoxious drunk patrons. But despite those issues, this place serves some seriously good sushi. The freshness is impeccable, sushi/sashimi here is superb. They pride themselves on some rarer Japanese imports, and the toro we sampled did not disappoint. Well worth the price. 

The rolls are also great. It's so refreshing to see a spin on spicy sushi that isn't a mass of less-than-fresh fish in a less-than-spicy mass of mystery mayo. The marinated spicy sushi is fresh and delicious, with a nice little kick. Veggies used within are also very fresh, and all of the rolls we had were light and flavorful. 

Prices in general were completely reasonable for the level of quality, and service was hectic, but solid. The place definitely has a tense/rushed/loud feel to it on a weekend night, which may turn off some. But that's also part of the appeal, if you like to get wasted with friends late at night while eating some seriously awesome sushi.
author: Robert K.

description:
You would never find this place if you weren't looking for it. Tucked in the basement of a building with a narrow doorway, people were lined up and down the steps for dinner on a Tuesday night.

Prices were extremely reasonable and the sushi was good. PLUS bottles of wine for $15 - what?! This is a great intimate place for a small get together or a date - not good for big groups.
author: Jessica N.

description: This place is great! The fish is always fresh, it's open late, there is a very good DJ playing good music. Service & ambulance is also nice. Love this fun & cozy downtown spot. There is usually a line to get a table though but it's worth it.
author: Diana M.

description:
Ryokos was PACKED!  Holy cow was it jam packed with people.  Talk about a fire hazard.  Then again I can't say much as I dined there for almost 2 hours.  The food was good and seeing as how our party or 11 ate almost everything on the menu I can attest that everything was delicious.  The service was on par, quick and always with a smile.

So you might ask why only 3 stars?  Well it was just OK.  I mean I had a great time and you are sure to as well but I can't say this was the most exciting place to grab some fresh fish.  The atmosphere is lively and warrants a night trip before binge drinking.  Try it out for yourself.
author: Kevin J.

description: Quite packed place, delicious Japanese food! Especially the beef under starter menu! Fresh made sushi as well. The waitress is very friendly!
author: Mengze Z.

description:
Horrible. First of all, the wait was ridiculously long partially due to the inefficiency of the staffing. The host was not attending and very disorganized. Several tables opened up for at least 20 minutes but she was busy chatting with people on the other table instead of sitting people waiting in the queue outside. 
Second, the food was below average. The fish and uni are very fresh but the rice was disproportionately small, far from being authentic. And the price was not cheap given the quality. Uni nigiri was 15 dollars per pair in a very small size. There are so many good sushi restaurants in the inner Richmond or the Mission that offers far more authentic food at a cheaper price than this.
Do not understand why this place was rated 4 stars by over 1.5k reviewers, maybe because it outopens other restaurants till 2am? Sigh. Disappointed.
author: Olivia H.

description: Hands down, awesome. I have sushi every week. This place offers and delivers quality Sushi.
author: Norma S.

description:
RYOKO sushi was delish. It definitely has that local feel. Great honest service and great quality sashimi. 

I recommend everyone try the Pokemon, the flying California and the one that has peanut butter. The peanut butter sounds weird but it's a perfect touch. 

I wish they took reservations. However, the wait isn't too bad if you come early but they are also open late. Great sushi spot.
author: Annie V.

description: Best Fish I've had!  Toro is pricey but exceptional
author: Vince R.

description: Kind of expensive but great place to eat at. You can be a sushi lover or an amateur doesn't matter, they are helpful and nice.
author: Shivam K.

description: This place is awesome! Down in this little basement, amazing sushi, so much fun! One of my faves in SF!
author: Sarah S.

description: Nice vibe, the best part was they opened up late until 2:00am, 2.5 stars for this place. Decent food quality, sushi was fresh. The only complaint was their high price and their portions were very small. They used only a little rice for the sushi, fish was thinner than before. I came here about two years ago and coming back for another try and hoping that they will improve on their portions. My family was disappointed again! Service there was fine and fast! But we felt like our waitress was a little pushy on the expensive items that were off the menu and a little pushy on us to order more food even we did ordered more food because we were still hungry after the first round. They even charged hot tea for $2.00 per person but not the fresh brewed tea because they only used a tea pot to re-brew the tea leaves for many rounds. All in all, this was the kind of place that was good for one time try, not for regulars.
author: Edwin Q.

description: Love this place! Sushi is one of a kind and have always had great service. Only reason not giving it 5 stars is the wait time but it's definitely worth it! The 49ers roll is a crowd pleaser and pairs very well with warm saki.
author: Jenni M.

description:
This place is bomb!

The sushi if fresh and amazing and the prices aren't too bad.  This is pretty authentic food too.  

It gets pretty crowded so try to make a reservation or get here early/very late.  The atmosphere is very young and friendly.  You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

Oh and their [pitcher of] Pilsner is pretty good and very reasonably priced.  Mmmm...sushi and beer.  Great combo.
author: Erin H.

description: Came here literally an hour after the place opened and the line was still outside the door! I stayed of course because I love sushi and I figured it must be something worth eating if people were willing to wait, standing in a staircase. We waited for about 45 minutes,the two of us, but drinks were offered to us while we waited. The sushi is a lot smaller than SoCal but still great tasting. I had the Checker roll, salmon sushi, and the golden gate roll. Great to stop by if you want sushi but be prepared to spend over $50 if you really want to get full.
author: Jasmine V.

description:
Great late night ambiance. Beautiful food and good prices. The staff is always on their game. 
Cool spot!
author: Christopher R.

description: My favorite sushi place in San Francisco, heck my favorite sushi place anywhere, period! I've been coming here for 12 years, back when Ryoko herself would chill at the bar with her awesomely big glasses and spunky personality. The sushi is fresh, most flown in from Japan daily. I've never had a single bad thing here. And the staff! The staff is amazing - they're friendly and attentive. Atsushi has to be my fav though, master sushi chef, always happy to explain what something is and welcomes the opportunity for you to tell him how hungry you are and let him take the wheel. His creations are great and if you get to know him, he remembers what you like and incorporates that into something unique and delicious! My only recommendation is that you try and get there at 6pm and line up with everyone else trying to get the first seating. Otherwise, you'll find yourself waiting a loooong time, especially on the weekend. If you do find yourself waiting, order a beer and wait on the stairs! It's worth the wait!
author: Sarah M.

description: Top notch sushi. Well prepared, but the portions are on the smaller side. So I'd call this place pricey. Another bonus: really good kara age.
author: Sandeep C.

description:
Ryoko's regularly draws a long line out the door, so come right at opening time if you want to be seated immediately (worked for us on a Friday night). I'm not sure why it has rave reviews, because it's not too much of a step up from any other Japanese restaurant in SF. The plates are mostly tapas-style, so you'll be getting less for your money than anticipated.

I got the Orange Delight roll ($13/6 pieces), which had fresh salmon but was nothing too mindblowing. We also tried the gyoza ($6/5 pieces), which is supposedly homemade but I would have believed you if you told me it came from the frozen section of Costco. 

Overall, I'm not impressed by the food and I don't think Ryoko's is worth a wait. It's decent and unoffensive, and that's pretty much the best thing I have to say about it. The decor is interesting - we sat next to a grand piano with an assortment of skulls perched on the cover.
author: Jessica F.

description: 4.5 stars. I'm big into sushi. The sushi is great. Not the best I've ever had. The extra half star is for the atmosphere AND the fact that they serve sushi until 12:15!!!!!!!!!! Please go!
author: Anthony S.

description: Nice ambience, great sashimi, good service, average rolls. The chef specials are a bit expensive and those are the delicious ones.
author: Sajib M.

description: Came here for NYE. Long wait but worth it! The ambience was great and the dj was spinning all night long. It's a cool Mashup between a sushi restaurant and a club. I ordered the 49 ers roll which was pretty disappointing. Just get a California roll for half the price. The dragon roll was great and dramatically plated. The dynamite roll which was deep fried was delicious as well! Can't wait to try more rolls!
author: Jane H.

description: It was ok. Nothing special in my opinion. I think they are extremely over priced for the amount of sushi you get. Tasted good but not worth the price and amount you get.
author: MT F.

description: Deep fried baby octopus lol... This place is great, great atmosphere. I like a 25 minute wait at a sushi spot and this is it. They run out of yellow tail some times but that just means it's hella fresh, like Ryoko
author: Nathan B.

description: I ordered the Chirashi dish and the fish slices were maybe 4 mm thick.   It was very thin and disappointing.  I had to order more nigiri and rice to fill myself.  I'm not sure how people rate them high as you are paying for the ambiance and not the food.  I will not go back.
author: J W.

description: We were looking for a Japanese restaurant near our hotel.  So we looked at Yelp, of course!  This place had very good reviews, but the line was incredibly long the first night we stopped by.  The next night we went earlier, and we still had to wait about 30 mins., but we did because of the great reviews!  If you go and it's your first time, make sure you walk down the stairs and write your name on the waiting list.  We were offered the drink menu while waiting in line, which was nice.  When we finally were seated, service was good overall.  Liked our waitress.  She was friendly and was able to describe/explain menu items and answer our questions well.  We started with the chicken karaage.  Crispy and juicy. Yum!  Also ordered the edamame.  Pretty standard.  For dinner we both ordered the sashimi dinner, and it was very good.  Fish was very fresh.  My hubby loves uni, so we also ordered it and it was delicious!  Love the authentic ambience of the restaurant and traditional sushi chefs.  Try it!
author: Dale H.

description: I am not quite sure what the hype is with this place. I think the vibe is good because of the live dj. Be forewarned that if you have a party of more than 2, the wait on a weekend evening will be long.  The restaurant is a bit grimy and tiny. The service is good and the hostess is very kind. I just don't understand the super high ratings simply because the food is not very great. The sushi rolls are not that imaginative and the quantity of pieces is small.  I think the food is quite average.  We had several rolls. The edamame is just plain. The miso soup is average and the chicken teriyaki is rubbery   I think my rating is skewed lower because of the hype. All in all Ryoko makes for a decent place to try because of the vibe and service but I wish the food was more inspired and tasty for me to want to return or refer.
author: Raj P.

description: This is a phenomenal sushi bar and restaurant. They fly in different fish and seafood daily making the menu extremely exciting. The monkfish liver app is SO GOOD. Got the warm sake and downed two bottles with my coworker. Easily a must dine restaurant when in SF. The service is friendly, food is amazing, which, inevitably means the line is always long. Went at exactly 6p when they opened to snag a table. I always opt to sit at the bar bc it's a more authentic experience.
author: Ashley C.

description: Absolutely delicious, FUN, great.   I seek this place out when I'm in town. I love when they greet you in Japanese as you walk down the stairs.   Everything on the menu melts in your mouth, and the lychee martinis are strong and tasty.   Love the environment, the friendly atmosphere if you sit at the bar, and everything else about Ryoko.
author: Scott H.

description:
I got the chefs choice sashimi plate which came with 9 pieces, I think. 

It was very fresh and very good. $30 bucks. Not too bad. 4 stars.

I also got the novelty Volcano roll. Don't waste your money. It sounds interesting and funky with jalapeño and peanut butter and tempura, but it's bland and uninteresting. 2 stars. 

The wait staff was fairly nice. 3.5 stars

The sushi chefs were sort of rude.

They didn't even yell in Japanese at me as I left :( I wish a sushi chef somewhere in the world could love me just for a moment... 1 broken hearted star :(
author: Ahmed A.

description: The only reason for this place is because it stay open late in neighborhood. We ordered appetizers( seaweed , fried baby octopus,) Ochazuke and lavarita , none of it can even be rated as "ok".   Odd vinegar seasoning for seaweed, sadly fried octopus, over grilled (reheated) salmon over Ochazuke, as a night bar, cocktail lavarita supposed to be attracting but disappointedly poorly mixed. Lemon, jalapeño and liquor simply through into overly iced glass. Service is quite slow with a half full bar. A lot of areas to improve...
author: Juliette X.

description: Good quality sushi, but very slow service, we ordered 3 sushi rolls and it took them about 30 min and we had to check on our order, not like we ordered hot items that requires cooking.  Anyways we went at 10pm and while we were waiting there were still lots ppl coming in, busy and noisy place.
author: C H.

description: I seriously wonder if this the same place others rave about? I went here twice in the same trip. Once on my own for fourth meal and another with a SF friend who raves about this place. It definitely popular, longish wait times but about right for SF. Underground, divey, smelly, buggy - I kinda expected more refined less bug ridden place. Sushi was decent but not mind blowing. This says a lot cause where I'm from, most mediocre SF sushi joints are equal to our best joints.
author: Hang W.

description:
This review is long overdue since my first and only experience, but here's the short: Sushi quality is pretty decent!

Nitty Gritty: Ambiance was very intimate with the low lighting and cozy seating. Definitely good points for a date. The pricing is a little high for the portioning, but the taste of the nigiri were pretty unforgettable. I just remember the fish being super fresh and tasty. No soy sauce needed. Good spot to get comfy with some friends or a date!
author: Ron P.

description: This place has THE BEST sushi I've ever had. It's beyond worth the money and the wait.
author: Geliah P.

description: Please is crowded. The environments are pretty loud. The food is really good but on the pricy side. The Uni and Salmon are to die for it is really really fresh! The raw scallop roll is very good also!
author: Clara L.

description:
Finally, a legitimate sushi restaurant in my area. Came here on Saturday around 6pm, and there was plenty of room, a line started forming at the door around 6:30 so try to arrive earlier if you want to avoid the wait.

What we ordered:
- giant clams
- some white tuna thing on their specials board
- salmon nigiri
- jumping tuna
-  ameibi (sweet shrimp)

I enjoyed all of the dishes we ordered, the fish was of the freshest I've had in a while, and my favorite part was that they give you fresh wasabi (might only come with certain dishes, this came with the tuna we ordered on their specials board). 

When i saw the jumping tuna roll on the menu, I almost passed since I've been trying to stay away from deep fried foods, but all the Yelp reviews said it was a must so I decided why not. Well, I'm glad i tried this roll, it was very well flavored and came with a special dipping sauce, which I'm pretty sure got overpowered by the excess amount of wasabi and soy sauce i use, but nonetheless the roll was still amazing; any of the "Jumping" rolls are a must try!

The atmosphere is small but nice, they blast trance/house music so it gives a nice vibe for the younger crowd. 

Added to my list of favorite sushi spots in SF :)
author: Angela K.

description:
4 stars - food was a sure 5, but service was slow and did not communicate well with the clientele. Also the space is hot and stuffy. The meal was fantastic though, and prices were very reasonable. 

We arrived at the restaurant and there was a short line going down the entry steps - we took this as a good sign. After a few minutes, a man entered behind us and we watched him walk down the staircase and write his name on a clipboard. Minutes later, the hostess arrived and called for him - that's when we realized we had to write our names down in order to get seated. We were a little frustrated but we kindly clued in those behind us in line. Just know that if the place is busy, you better get your name on that list. 

We waited for roughly 45 minutes. We could tell there was poor communication between the servers and the owner/manager - they would often call for the wrong people on the list and we had to correct them. Eventually we were seated and the space, though hot, is relatively quiet. You are very close to your neighbors so be prepared to have your conversation overheard. 

We ordered miso soup and edamame, both very good, and four different rolls. My favorite was the Jumping California - it came with a delicious sweet and hot sauce and it was warm from the fryer - absolutely wonderful. We also tried Tahoe, 49er's, and Spicy Golden Gate. Very fresh fish and reasonably priced. 

Overall the meal was right what we were looking for. Our waitress was kind and attentive once we were seated and our food arrived in a timely fashion. Only major cons were the experience when we entered the restaurant while waiting to be seated and the heat of the basement. Would definitely return to this spot when visiting SF.
author: Liz B.

description: This place is GARBAGE! The waitress was rushing for me to order. After ordering I got a hand roll which has a green spinach or something in it that wasn't washed down with water!!!!all I was tasting was soap! I pulled it out and it finally tasted normal. The soy sauce on the table was mixed with water so it didn't have any flavor it's like dipping your sushi in water. Also the food quality is poor. I don't know how this place has so many reviews and 4 stars, I don't know how this place is in business it looks like a dump. Pass up on this place, it's overhyped. 0 for the restaurant, 1 star for the dj.
author: Arman A.

description: The food was great the atmosphere was fun , staff was friendly place  was upbeat I will definitely be going back when I'm in San Francisco highly  recommend the spot .
author: Vicky F.

description:
Place is great, gets crowded fast. 

Make sure you know exactly what you're ordering. A mispronunciation made the difference between a $7 nigiri dish and a $27 one. To be fair, it was very very good -- just came as a bit of a shock when the bill came.
author: Taylor S.

description: Very, very disappointed. I really don't know what all the fuss was about. Sushi was very small and extremely expensive for what it had to offer. Come on - $9.00 for two small pieces of hamachi sushi? $20 for two pieces of uni sushi?? This place is a rip off. What really surprised me was the huge line up that quickly gathered shortly after 6:30. What are these people doing , waiting for an hour or more for mediocre sushi that costs an arm and a leg? We ate a few sushi orders, the Pokemon roll (trust me the name is a lot more cute that'll you'd expect ) , the deep fried soft shell crab, a bottle of cold sake - $70 later we were still hungry. We simply had to go. I'm taking my money to a proper sushi joint that isn't a rip off!
author: Rosaline C.

description: Expect wait time, especially on a Friday evening. We got there at 7pm and waited about 45 minutes. Excellent and reasonable food, great lively vibe. Music on weekends from the DJ is a bonus! Plenty of options on the food menu, nigiri and sushi were both very good. Make sure to check out their specials which are typically listed from Japan! Either way, food was good! Definitely will be revisiting this restaurant for sushi cravings!
author: Priyanka M.

description:
Grat atmosphere and very attentive staff. The fish offerings are great, but the rolls I tried were a little too involved and random ingredients masked the fish.

Great spot for late night sushi though. Maybe next time I'll stick to the nigiri
author: Cam V.

description: Excellent sushi and stiff drinks. Expect a wait, but worth it, and they will serve you a drink while you wait.
author: Angela B.

description:
Service was friendly, and prompt. We didn't have to wait to be seated at the bar. The food we ordered came on timely manner. 

We had a high expectation for the sushi, the Sashimi Dinner, was not up to our expectation. We had hoped for more variety of seafood, and more quantity for the price. The food from kitchen;Agedashi tofu and Gyoza, and the dessert: Warabi Mochi was fine & tasty.
author: Gwen R.

description: Overhyped and not worth the wait. I arrived on Saturday at 6:30 and waited until 8 to start eating. The music was loud, and it was extremely warm and humid inside. The fish was okay but I would not come back.
author: Ally C.

description:
Nothing like a little basement sushi to welcome you to San Francisco. I found this place on yep, you guessed it, Yelp! Not too far from the hotel I was staying at I jumped in a cab and headed here.  Secret sushi speakeasy should be it's name because if you didn't know about this place it would be super unassuming.

We sat at the sushi bar since that was the only space and sho' enough as soon as we sat down about 20 people came in right after and had to wait in line (suckas). The free edamame was awesome though not the best or most fresh, but, it was free so this gal ain't gonna complain too much.

My plus one and I ordered the sashimi plate and a few rolls including one of their deep fried rolls. So, the sashimi plate made me realize that I really don't like sashimi. I like the tuna of course and the salmon but, the other wierd ass fishies/tentacles I really just don't enjoy that much. I still ate it but, why, why, do I try to convince myself that I'm this sashimi samurai when I'm just not? Regardless, it was good, freshy and meaty but, one better be somewhat adventurous since it is Chef's selection.

The rolls were solidly good and I enjoyed them, nothing to write home about but, nonetheless they were tasty. As I mentioned above I also went with one of their deep fried rolls - the jumping unagi.  It was interesting but, I don't think I would ever order it again. It didn't taste like a roll at all since it had a crispy, oily, sweet outter crunch that most definitely took away from the fish. The concept could have been amazing but I think in actuality it doesn't really satisfy the dream.

Overall,  four stars since this place is cool as hell and I would definitely recommend.  I'll probably not come back since I don't visit SF that often and when I do I want to try different spots. Glad I got the opportunity to check this spot off my SF bucket list.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
We went at 10pm on a Tuesday with an hour wait. It was well worth it! It's downstairs, hole in the wall kind of place, with a lot of mirrors, and can be confusing after a few of their delicious Mai Tais. We ordered all of their available sashimi specials,  (you knew they were fresh because when they were out they were out- a good sign of quality) and at the end asked for two more rolls and said, "just surprise us and make something special." They brought out 2 special rolls one was lemon and asparagus based and the other was smoked salmon, raw salmon, and crispy salmon skin. 

The staff were all friendly and attentive. We were in the back room, on a busy night and didn't have a problem with great service. Highly recommend!
author: Nicole V.

description:
Overrated.  Came here for a late night snack.  It was a Thursday night around 11pm and the wait was still almost an hour.  If only the food were worth it...

People probably come here cause it's open late and they have a DJ.  I can't imagine the reason being for amazing food.

Also, good luck having a conversation with anyone in your group.  You won't be able to hear anyone who is sitting more than 1 foot away from you.

Ordered:
Spicy Golden Gate Roll $7-Spicy salmon, shiso, cucumber, and flying fish roe over the top
Pokemon Roll- $11.50- Salmon, mango, avocado, and green
leaf lettuce, wrapped with soy paper  (Sounds delicious right?  It's not.  It's really bland tasting)

The portions for the rolls are really small..  Thought about ordering more, but since those two rolls were so mediocre, we decided to waste our money elsewhere and went over to a 24 hour Indian restaurant.
author: Michele L.

description: My second time here - glad I decided to come back.  Had to wait 30 min on a Wed night for one chair at the sushi bar but it is worth it.
author: Eric D.

description:
My friend from HK wanted her bday dinner to be all about American sushi rolls, (since HK just provides sashimi and nothing else that's special). She yelped this place herself! Since Zushi Puzzle rejected us, dang them.
Once you open the doors you will witness that it is actually a basement kind of restaurant. You would hear screams from all over the restaurant in Japanese by the waiters and waitresses. The environment is really dim and mellow.. dim red lights.. It was like a mix of Mexican and Japanese to me.. I don't know why, maybe because of the pictures they had framed on the walls.

The wait for the food took a bit, since they brought everything to us at once. We ended up ordering... 
(ratings out of 5 1=blehhh 5=HOLY SHIT THAT WAS HELLA GOOD!)
1. Salmon Skin roll - 3 (my friend really liked this one because it was crunchy)
2. Philadelphia roll - 4 I thought this was good, the cream cheese definitely made the best of it.
3. Big Mama - 3 spicy eel! yum!
4. Orange Delight - 3 the salmon was good!
5. Spicy Golden Gate - 4 spicy and crunchy at the same time!
6. Checkerboard 2 - meh, kinda forgot which one it was

Overall though, I didn't think this place was TOO special. We weren't full and they charged us for $2 for tea! The sushi had interesting names but it wasn't to die for. The environment was a 3 out of 5. They almost sat us at a table that reached only up to our knees, I saw the table next to us disregard the chair and end up sitting on the floor instead. No thanks. We ended up paying $20 each since we treated out the birthday girl. Afterwards we went to King of Thai for some more filling food.
author: Linda K.

description: This place in in a great location and has a really cool atmosphere but in order to uphold that you need good quality food!!! And that was most definitely not my experience! They served me sashimi that tasted like it has been sitting out for over an hour and we complained and still got charged full price! I am extremely surprised this place has such great reviews. Gross!! I hope I don't have food poisoning in the morning!
author: Mario C.

description: This sure WAS my favorite sushi place. But not till my recent visit. It will be a pretty decent amount of wait depending on the time of the night. On my recent visit, I had a Rainbow and Spicy Golden gate sushi rolls. I had the rainbow sushi roll before and I remember it being at least 10 pieces (or more) and even had a hard time finishing it since it was more than I thought. Since I was pretty hungry, I ordered it and got seven pieces of rolls. I was astounded upon seeing it since it costs 20 dollars and all I had was seven tiny pieces. Even the spicy golden gate roll barely had rice around it. I know its SF, and food is pretty pricey but I think this just went over the top. I usually don't complain about the price knowing that it will be a really good food but this is just crazy. I even confirmed it to the server and he told me that's just how it goes. I left the restaurant very unsatisfied.
author: Jovel D.

description: Very fresh and good quality fish, but its very small pieces.  We ordered 8 different kind of nigiri from the board that saying its special from Japan, it's very good, but you don't feel like you ate the sushi because its so small pieces. The $3 oyster was amazing.  Super fresh and delicious.  Stay away from the squid,  nothing special and cost too much. Order the scallop sushi and ankimo appetizer, very sweet and delicious. The bill was about $140 for 2 people,  but we didn't feel full at all. Very expensive.  We wish the portion could be a little bigger since it costs so much. Very friendly staff, keep checking on us.
author: Che K.

description:
Came here with my sister based on Yelp reviews, and it was slightly disappointing.  The food was average, the prices were a little high, and portion size was fairly small.  They seemed to have forgotten about us several times, with missing appetizers and sushi rolls - after spending more than $70 on just food alone, we were still a little hungry.

The one bright side was the atmosphere, as this restaurant resides in a dark-lit Japanese sushi bar basement style.  The bar area looks fun, but the dining tables/chairs were not comfortable.  

Tips: look for the specials posted behind the sushi chefs - they have much more imaginations there than their regular dinner/sushi menu.
author: Sam L.

description:
AMAZING ! well worth the wait. Definitely get the jalapeno peanut butter roll. Soudns weird but the mix of flavors is awesome.
I also really like the pokemon and salmon mango avocado roll
I have been here multiple times because it is right in my neighborhood and it never disappoints. 
Only thing I would change is for them to take reservations!
author: Jillian C.

description: Holy expletive! This is the bomb. Look no further. I could've stayed here all night. Order everything!
author: Phil G.

description: Place could definitely use a facelift. The basement is dark but funky cool. I've been here a few times and it's always packed. Long line up the stairs and out the door so put your name on the list. Service was ok. I was surprised at the smaller portions. Tiny nigiri. Menu remains limited. Best years were when Ryoko-san was walking around barking orders at the staff. Funny to watch. But it seems this place has lost some character and it keeps worsening with each visit. Not horrible yet so I'll be back but seeking alternatives.
author: Ty M.

description:
I'm not sure what the hype is. 

The first time I came here, they were out of uni. There was a huge wait but lucky for my single self, I rolled in to get my prime time seat at the bar. 

The second time I came, it was with a group of friends. We waited for about 40 minutes but we got our table. It was right after a birthday night so frankly, we all were exhausted. We opted for green tea (not your typical St. Patrick's Day drink) and were quite eager to call it a night. When the bill came, it was about $79. I was like woah! We didn't even order that much AND we didn't even drink! Here's what we ordered:

Food:

We ordered the sexy roll - nice, fattening, with melted cheese
Pokemon roll - meh ...nice mango
Seaweed salad - can't mess that up...
Some other roll...but it had crunchy shrimp...also meh...

The rolls were in SUPER small portions. I was still hungry after...

At this point, I just wanted to go home. I think that the bill was a little pricey but I just want to sign and peace out. My friend got charged $26, the other got charged $36, and then I got charged $36. I don't think we noticed we weren't charged the same thing (who look's at their friend's bill all nosey...right? You just trust that the people can divide by 3...) 

My friend woke up on her walk home and was like we got over charged! She called the restaurant and said that she and her friend (me) got overcharged by $10. My friend lives down the block so she easily went in the next day and the people were super nice! They refunded her her money and settled the case. 

I then manage to take 2 buses to get back to the restaurant and finally make it by Tuesday! 
1) They asked for an itemized receipt...what? I only have my signed copy...
2) The manager told me that the case was already settled. Uh yea! With my friend, but she called for me too! 
3) I said the bill was $79 and 79 divided by 3 is $26! Then the manager says "I remember the bill being $90 something

OKAY...let's do some math...

If you refunded my friend $10 from $36...that leaves you with $26 + $26 + my supposed $36 DOES NOT EQUAL $90 SOMETHING! Then she said "oh well then I don't remember I have to check. ANd I was like wouldn't the prices between the three of us be equal SINCE WE SPLIT THE BILL?!?!?!

Anyway, she said she would go to the "corporate offices" and inquire about my $10. Which means another 2-bus bus ride, just to get a refund when they clearly do not know arithmetic. Ugh, not even worth the stupid $10 anymore...jeez! 

-Long wait
-Meh food
-Over-charging
-HELLA inconvenienced to fix the over-charging..

I'm going to Sudachi...I love that place! :)
author: Leena B.

description:
The atmosphere isn't much to speak of but dinner was great. We spanned the gamut from nigiri to rolls to sashimi.  Service was very nice. A little slow but worth the wait. 

If it was a little cleaner I'd give it five stars.
author: Stuart R.

description: Absolutely the best sushi creative fresh asked for extra ginger no problem great service great pricing you will not be disappointed
author: Lee H.

description: I had heard and seen how crowded this place was, so I never planned to go during my visit. However, I walked by looking for some desert - it was 7pm on Friday and there was no line. Ok - sushi for dessert. I ordered 3 of their recommended sashimi and it was the best fish I've ever had (and properly served at room temp). Eat here if you can. The green tea was super earthy and delightful too.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Oh how I love this place. Whenever I am back in SF it is a solid go to. I have also brought many out of townees here and they loooove it. It is exactly the kind of funky SF restaurant they want to experience. Go early! Before 7:30 if you can or you will find yourself with a massive line.
author: crystal j.

description: The sushi is worth the long wait. Very fresh, and have a special menu of fish flown in from Japan. A must go if your in San Fran, volcano roll with peanut butter was my favorite !
author: Kristina T.

description:
"Sumimasen!" 

You definitely know this place is poppin when you hear this left and right every 5 mins. You should definitely come early if you don't wanna get caught in the rush and sit around waiting along the stairs! Got here at 5:45PM today before it opened up and that's exactly what it looked like when we left the door an hour later!

I don't know about you but when it comes to sushi, I like it raw! I usually get the hamachi sashimi, so I was kinda disappointed that they only offered it in 2 pcs! I would highly recommend the chirashi bowl cause the sushi is super fresh and just down right mouthwatering! It's "melts-in-your-mouth GOODNESS!!" The scallops were sweet and juicy just the way I like it! Also tried the Philly roll and the hamachi roll (coz I needed more than 2 pcs!). If my stomach allowed for it I would've tried some of the fried oysters my boyfriend ordered but I was just left too fully satisfied. I think this sushi experience was just an overall smashing success! Service was very welcoming and super friendly too, which is always a plus in my book! Be prepared to bring some dough though cause this place can be a tad bit pricey.

I would most definitely come back to try the other stuff on the menu!  Get at me again with that freshness Ryoko! ;)
author: Alexis A.

description:
I like that this place is kind of hidden and downstairs with an old wooden interior (speakeasy like) yet modern in taste and style.  The Jumping California, and Volcano roll were very good.  Friend and I also had the tempura and agedashi tofu which were perfectly fried dipped in tasty light sauces.

Lived up to the hype.  

It is loud and the music is very contemporary pop and electronica contrast to what the interior looks like but it adds to the experience of the urban sushi style people enjoy.

Gets crowded.
author: Dawn N.

description:
If you would have blind-folded me and walked me through here I would NOT have guessed this was a Japanese restaurant, I would have guessed it to be a dive bar.  Also, if you had me go in when no one was there, I would have guessed cool bar based on the decor but not a Japanese restaurant.  

#1 Fried Cheese!!!  If you love cheese, GET THIS!  It says something when melted cheese melts more in your mouth because it is so amazing.

Not sure of the name of the one with melted cheese on top but GET IT! you will NOT be disappointed.  Also, the volcano roll has Peanut Butter in it, GET IT! You will LOVE IT!  If you do not like it I will pay you back.  (not really but it sounded good right?)

Overall - It's like a clean dive bar that serves sushi.
author: Colleen B.

description:
Came here twice in one week because it was that great!

First time here, we actually met the owner Ryoko himself! He was sitting at the bar right next to us and shared a croquette with us as well. We ordered the chirashi, eggplant tempura, and also the jumping tuna roll. The sushi here is definitely higher quality than most sushi joints. 

The place is also great for post outings at night since it closes at 2AM. Late at night they have a DJ playing some top 40's hip hop music while you eat. I would definitely recommend ordering the eggplant tempura and the rolls! Will be back for sure.
author: Stephen C.

description:
I'm at SFO, having just flown back from a business trip.  EVERY TIME, I'm tempted to will go directly there, in my business suit, with my suitcase! Occasionally, i give into temptation, storing my suitcase under their piano and changing into jeans/t-shirt in the bathroom.  Apparently i'm not the only one. Japanese baseball players are know to stop by after playing the Giants.  I've even seen Manny Ramirez (hate LA, but he's actually a nice guy) 

I have tried some 25-30 different sushi rstrnts since coming to SF 3 years go and this is pretty much my fav. The thing is its not upscale (blue walls and basement), often long lines, and gets little loud with the DJ on wknds, but its worth it!! In fact, its kinda cool! 

What should you order?  That's easy!

Don't stare too long at the menu, just look up at the board (fish from Japan, Spain, Brazil, ,Seattle, where ever), that what's fresh and good for the day.  I can't pronounce all the names, but just ask and someone will guide you to happiness. 

Indeed, everyone has their test of a great sushi place and mine is their saba (mackerel).  Its takes a great curing liquid to make great saba (he still won't tell me what it in). My friend's test is the salmon skin roll...guess what, it rocks!   

Nevermind that seasoning the sushi rice is redone if its not just right.  The gyoza is handmade and a family recipe. No one folds the tamago (egg) except the head chef. The sake selection is biased toward the regions with the best water. If you want the collar (kama) of whatever fish, just ask and they might have one left. Amaebi comes perfectly butterflied, and few minutes later the head comes out lightly batter and deep-fried crispy, the prefect little snack while finishing your sake or beer.  

Post Script: 
If you must do maki rolls, try the hot tuna, hot tail, jumping tuna, peanut butter roll (try it, it somehow works).  OR ask for the "special roll". Its not on the menu and basically only made by the chef who created it (hope he's there that night). Warning: it has raw fish and a sliver of jalapeno, so if you can't do either, stick to the menu!
author: Joseph C.

description:
Stopped by for a late bite. Got there 12 midnight it was going strong after 1am.

Nice selection of rolls, some traditional and some way out there. I can tell that thought and innovation was baked into the menu.

Judging by the crowd, it was for those that knew a good thing when they found it.

Good selection to cold sake, and chill atmosphere. I could get used to this.
author: Peter K.

description:
Decent little spot to grab some Japanese food during your late night excursions. This restaurant stays open every night 'till 2am. Yup, 'cuz that's how they roll. Party rock is in the houuuuse toniiiiiight! It does, in fact, give off that night club type of vibe. It's also nice to know that there are 'okay' options for food that late into the night.

I've only ordered simple appetizers from here which included the hiyayako, the yakitori, and the ochazuke. All were fine and all, but what disappointed me was that it took close to a whole grueling hour before I finally received any food... Not to mention that the actual hiyayako dish that I ordered is quite literally two simple cuts of chilled tofu with bits of garnish on top. Does it really take that long to prepare hiyayako? I thinketh not!

Otherwise, the ochazuke was probably my favorite among the appetizers. Tasty, homey, and perfect in either the pickled plum or salmon variation. Another very simply prepared dish.

The servers were very nice and apologetic. Although Ryoko's takes forever and ever to push out the grub, I believe in second chances... I'll probably be back for another round of ochazuke if I'm ever craving it again... but perhaps not at vampire hours and with a severe grumbling belly. Booooo...
author: Ann S.

description:
As we descended into this basement sushi oasis, the techno music greeted my ears with delight, and soon I shared a glass of sake with some other patrons patiently waiting for a table. 

We were then escorted to a nice table for 2 tucked away in a cove where I could consume copious amounts of sake anonymously, I enjoy sake like I am used to my weather back in Michigan, cold and cloudy. We were served up some delicious rolls, and I tried a bit of monk fish liver, the foie gras of the sea. Although it was delightful, I felt a bit of guilt consuming it and I wouldn't likely order it again. 

The following night, after voluminous amounts of drinking at very establishments around San Fran, we found ourselves back at Ryoko's for round number 2. This time we arrived just before close, and sat at the bar. The gentlemen behind the bar were thrilled for me to speak the word "omakase" and he proceeded to illuminate my taste buds behind what I thought possible. I was hammered but I vaguely recall glorious  octopus ceviche (only to be topped on my trip to Ecuador) and a bountiful cornucopia of nigiri.

Ryoko's, I am a satisfied customer.
author: Ben B.

description: Wait was long (although very worth it) and the hostess and staff were friendly. The fish (sushi) was extremely fresh and not made with too much rice like a lot of other sushi places. The fried chicken was surprisingly tasty that we had to order 2 orders. I ordered beef teriyaki well done and it was cooked perfectly well done yet still juicy which is not easy to do (was very impressed).
author: Helen J.

description: This place was recommended by a friend so I had to check it out. The seafood was fresh and presentation was good. Service was good as well. Would definitely be headed back here next time I'm in the city!
author: Christina M.

description: Cool underground vibe, fun dancey music, finely crafted sushi rolls, appealing presentation, and quick service. Be sure to arrive 10 minutes before they open at 6pm because there's usually a line!
author: Benjamin K.

description: Food was good and fresh this place would of deff received 5 stars except for the fact that I was ripped off. When the bill came I decided to use a visa gift card I'd got as a birthday gift last year. I double checked the balance before dinner, there was  $150.00 on the card. My bill total was about $138.00 I gave the gift card to the waitress she came back and said she was only able to run it for $125.00 I asked if she was sure because I had double checked before dinner, she said yes. I thought it was simply because visa cards potentially had some type of limit per transaction. I payed the remaining balance in cash and also left a $40 tip which now I'm kicking myself for because this morning after checking the charges on the card, it shows they did run the card for the full $150. It's not the money that bothered me but the feeling of being ripped off that too me is fraud be AWARE of they're dirty tactics.
author: Lunessa C.

description: I cannot even begin to explain how amazing this place was from the food to the atmosphere everything was absolutely great! I had two sushi rolls to start of with one was the spicy tuna and the second one was the Philadelphia roll. The Philadelphia was so delicious I had to order another roll. My sister and I have been raving about since we went. When we're back to San Francisco no doubt that we will be back to Ryoko's.
author: Oriana G.

description:
Came here on a whim remembering a recommendation from a friend. Definitely fresh fish, enjoyed the very Japanese feel.

Food: 4.5/5 - had the sashimi plate (octopus, mackerel, scallop, red tuna, hachibi, and salmon for that night) and added on some toro (fatty tuna) sashimi. You can tell that their sashimi slices are fresh and that they only use the best because their octopus sashimi wasn't chewy or tasteless but well textured and tasty (in fact THE tastiest tako sashimi I've ever had). Also, their red tuna wasn't too pasty but held together great when eaten. All their other sashimi pieces were incredibly fresh, and well presented! Their toro also came in large slices and I was well pleased with their cut and tenderness of the fatty tuna :). Not exactly pasty like red tuna, not exactly buttery like salmon, but perfectly in between with the added hint of the fish fat flavor. I can't give this a fiver because I wasn't able to sample more items from other sections of their menu, but definitely some of the freshest sashimi I've ever had the opportunity to try.

Cost: 4/5 - you get what you pay for nothing more, nothing less. Can be on the pricy side for some, but they say the fish comes freshly imported from Japan! 

Service: 3.5/5 - this place is packeddddddd so their servers are busy busy busy. Could be nicer, could speak better english had some trouble understanding what they said.... But they were attentive and once we were able to sit down the food came quickly for a restaurant that was operating at 100% capacity. 

Ambience: 4/5 - arrived to a line up and was told the wait was going to be 45mins for a party of 2, but ended up waiting 5mins so that was lucky. It's an old place that is jazzed up with Japanese decorations and there is a dj that is set up to play on top of a baby grand piano... haha. So let's say hipster(?). It's full, but manageable noise level. Always feels nice ti eat in a restaurant that others are enjoying as well.
author: Monika-Bianca T.

description: The vibe here is very nice and outgoing. All the workers who I've encountered were all very friendly and the people who I bumped into while waiting were very talkative. It could be quite crowded here so expect to wait around a little, however in my opinion it was definitely worth it. The good music blasting and the very appetizing food they served was more than enough to convince me to come back. The sushi itself tasted very fresh along with all the other appetizers I had ordered. It's not too horribly expensive however do expect smaller sized proportions. Not that it's extremely bad though, plus the fresh and appetizing flavors made up for it. I'd definitely recommend this place if you're just looking for a good time to crash after a long day of work or something of the sort with coworkers.
author: Sandra S.

description:
I have never been to a sushi place that a) charged for tea, which is is just shameful or b) serves rolls that are SO SMALL. I don't know why this place has only two dollar signs on yelp. I felt that the menu was deceptive; "rolls" are actually 5 really thinly cut pieces and half of the time imitation crab is served when the menu advertises "crab". Some of the other reviewers mentioned that "salmon" can also mean smoked salmon...I believe that completely. The wait for food is long for a sushi place, too.

The sushi was good, but not mind-blowing - that's the only reason why I stuck with 2 stars and not 1.
author: Zahra G.

description:
Tip number one: you cannot get cell phone service in this establishment, so if you're waiting for friends you'll need to stand outside. 

Tip number two: If you're a vegetarian order the "jumping veggie roll" it's awesome!

Tip number three: skip the mochi ice cream for dessert, you're better off picking up some from Trader Joe's.
author: Josie C.

description: A basement sushi house!! Open late, too. The nigiri was fresh and tasty, albeit with seemingly elevated pricing, but the rolls, also fresh and delicious are reasonably priced. The atmosphere is dark though inviting, and the crowd lively and friendly, as are the servers and chefs. It's definitely a gem of a sushi restaurant.
author: Frank L.

description: Awesome sushi. Amazing rolls. Hamachi flown in fresh from Japan was delicious!  Definitely worth the trip. No reservations. There's always a line. Well worth the wait.
author: Christina O.

description:
The food here is good but the service last night was the worst thing that ever happened to me.

They are severely understaffed and getting your server's attention is like trying to get a celebrity autograph at the Oscars...not happening. 

Everyone raves about the sushi here and quite frankly it's not worth the wait. On Friday/Saturday nights you can expect to wait for an hour or more. 

Was not pleased with the experience. Boo.
author: Michelle A.

description: Was really excited to eat here. Big disappointment. Super awkward waiting area (on stairs). Waiting for an hour for a tiny table on a Thursday night. Food wasn't any better than sakana across the street on post. Understaffed. Asked 6 times for water. Give a number or a beeper to people that have to wait? Maybe even take reservations? OVER PRICED. Their sashimi cuts were so tiny for the price. Smalley toro slices ever. Waitress was rude. Oh and the best part, they would not allow me to take me sashimi to go???? Because they "ensure the quality of their food". What? So weird. Not going back, that's for sure. Sakana all the way!
author: Michelle G.

description:
Great place to go out for a dinner. Cool atmosphere &good music. On weekends they have a dj! 
The service is pretty good and fast. The food is good but nothing to die for.
The only thing that is annoying- there is always a line and you need to wait around 40 min- hour to get a table.  
Great place for a small group night out.
author: Yana A.

description:
Surprisingly fresh fish. Reasonable price. Fun ambiance. 

Definitely coming back!
author: Michelle K.

description: We came here with my friends total 6 people. We were waiting for 1 hour and half to get table and people who came after us also got table before us:(. Service was horrible and slow. Food was okay not that great. Especially DO NOT order the oyster. They weren't as fresh as we expected. Never come back.
author: Guojun D.

description:
