Their food i would say is above the average jap restaurants. We got the spider roll, spicy tuna deep fried, agedashi tofu, bbq shrimp, and tobiko nigiri. I must say the spider roll was great!! Definitely the best spider roll i ever had. The spicy tuna roll, i'm not a fan. It was not even spicy tuna inside :( it was just plain tuna.. And i wish they use some kind of spicy sauce and eel sauce on top. It would've tasted 10x better. The bbq garlic shrimp was supeeeer yummy! I loved it! I definitely recommend ppl to order that. They have great service also! Loved it here even if their portion/ rolls were a little small!
author: Verdina P.

description:
came here the other day and didnt really like it all that much.

wait time was horrendous...i mean granted it was a weekend night and all, but after putting our name down we left for over an hour, THEN had to wait another 25 minutes before being seated...as an impatient person...this wasnt my thing right off the bat.

menu options were grossly overpriced for the quality of food that they served to us. no "special" rolls ordered...more of the chef's specials of the day, such as geoduck (giant clam) and chutoro fatty tuna...for 2 orders of the geoduck and 1 order of the fatty tuna, they charged over 60 bucks....i cant even get into the dozens of places i would rather go to have these items...also ordered the usual staples...agedashi tofu...tonkatsu...a few other typical pieces of sashimi and nigiri...nothing was exceptional...

the only thing that stands out about this place is that they have a dj...if you wanna have a fun time and not pay too much money...order up a few of the specialty rolls with some friends then get beer and sake...fun place to drink with the loud music and all but if youre looking for super fresh, super quality sushi...probably not the place for you.
author: Kyu L.

description:
I like this place, it is lively and fun.  Though it is a little slow, I could care less, it is more of a lounge anyway, sit back and relax people.  I was surprised how happening this place was at 11:15pm on a Thursday, but it made me feel less annoyed that I was eating so late.  Though it was bustling, I was happy that it had good acoustics and I could actually hear the person across from me.

Peanut butter - well they do indeed have peanut butter in their volcano roll and its s surprisingly good.  It is subtle and provides for a unique roll

Hot tune - I loved this spicy tuna roll because I love spicy tuna! I agree with other reviews that its really nice to have chunks instead of tuna mush.

The only thing that I was iffy about was the edamame that is complimentary, I prefer mine warm or hot, when it's cold it feels a little slimy.

I definitely recommend this place!!
author: Caitlin H.

description:
This place was bumpin. I certainly did not expect this sushi bar to be pumping out club music haha. There was a dj with all her gear on top of a piano! Definitely SF hipster. 

Anyway, the sushi. It was good. We sat at the sushi bar and ordered hamachi toro, white toro, salmon, tuna, and scallop. We also had a salmon skin cut roll, which was excellent, and the 49ers roll (salmon and tuna on top of crab/avocado roll), which I thought was just okay for a $14 roll. I would say that the salmon sushi was probably my favorite...ahhh so yummy! Oh and I also had a tofu special appetizer - a block of tofu in chilled soba sauce, and also a clam miso soup that I thought was pretty yummy.

The sushi chef was super chill - he was once an architectural engineer in Japan! He tended to us really well :) I noticed some other customers at the bar had to wait a long time to get their sushi orders, but we were able to get what we wanted almost immediately, as he would kindly serve us when we requested something.

To top off all the delicious fish, I had red bean mochi ice cream. And mm it was just perfect! 

All in all, if you're looking for a typical quiet Japanese restaurant with fishy fish and rude servers, this place is not for you!
author: Jamie F.

description:
Make a reservation 24 hours in advance. Otherwise, prepare yourself for a long wait.

Orders:
Chardonnay
Kirin
Saba Shioyaki
Deep fried oysters
Tofu Salad
Big Mama Roll (2)- why I can't stay away from Ryoko!
Cruncy Crab Roll
Sexy Roll- nothing sexy about it unfortunately. 

Grand total including tax & tip $85+
Fish quality is great, but portion size is horrifically tiny. I think they run on the policy of less being more which is sad news for my belly.
author: Rosa L.

description: Ryoko's is a terrific place to go for sushi, including really good veggie sushi that is artfully presented. The appetizers are also veggie friendly, including some delicious tempura. Everything is super fresh and the staff is friendly. It's also perfectly situated for a pre-theatre snack if you are taking in a show at the Curran, SF Playhouse or ACT. Try to make it there before 7pm, otherwise you will have to wait a bit, because it fills up quickly. The service is fast and mostly efficient. I definitely plan to go back.
author: Nicole M.

description:
Food: (5 starts): high-quality sashimi; creative and tasty maki; we had the Checkerboard, Orange Delight, and one other roll (forgot the name)...all were great; somewhat small portions, but the fish-to-rice ratio is perfect (read: high)

Atmosphere (4 stars): fun, somewhat chaotic, hipster vibe; feels like you're having sushi in your cool friend's parents' basement  in the mid 1980s with a DJ; mix of tourists and hipsters; crowded yet intimate

Service (3 stars): the servers are "all business"...they have no time to give you any personalized attention but they keep the tables turning quickly. So, set your expectations accordingly and you'll be fine. They did happen to skip over our name on the very long wait list. If you're going to be "all business", you need to get it right.

Price (5 stars): very reasonable for high-quality sushi; I closed my tab at $49 with beer, 1/2 sake and sushi
author: Ali M.

description:
3.5

FOOD:
1.) Chirashi = Chef's choice was alright. Shoulda gotten all tuna instead. 


SERVICE:
Not bad.


ATMOSPHERE:
This place totally feels Korean ... for some reason... haha. There's stairs going down right at the entrance. Carpeted flooring... Grand piano in the middle, with a DJ spinning. lol. Randoms. Maybe fitting for a Friday night? Sushi bar to the right..
author: Angela L.

description: Been going here for years and still in love.  Cool, dark atmosphere and super fresh fish.
author: Cody W.

description:
On a Friday night for a party of 5, we waited and waited for over an hour for a table even though smaller parties were seated before us.  The waitress appeased us with sake and edamame, but to be seated sooner would've been preferable, of course!  The sushi rolls were ok (very filling, not too memorable, the sashimi could've been fresher), but the hamachi kama (yellowfin jaw area) was the bomb (!!! - very tasty) and I enjoyed the tofu agedashi.  

I would go back with a smaller party -- other than that, the restaurant was decent and I appreciated the efforts of the seating waitress to appease us while we waited (and waited....).
author: Maile N.

description:
Konichiwa!...mmm... Fresh and delicious sushi makes my tummy smile.
Seriously though this spot has great attributes:
-great date spot
-sometimes live music (they have a dj)
-Japanese Owned by this crazy Japanese lady that walks around with hugh glasses and says, "Domo arigato gazimatsu!."
-Music is off the hook (modern..a mix up..hiphop,electronica, old school..etc)
-House sake is pure and sweet
-Jumping California roll is to die for with their sweet sauce
-Free candy! (they have it in a bowl on top of the piano)
-Great atmosphere ( it's like I'm at a lounge)
-Open til 2am!
-Wonderful Birthday Spot (I had my 24th Birthday here with about 20 something of my friends and I had a wonderful time eating scrumptious sushi and drinking Saki..they even played music I requested...reserved 2 huge rooms for us)

Overall this place is off the hook, I've taken friends from New York, Las Vegas, Las Angeles and Japan to this spot and they all would agree that Ryoko's is a SF spot you definitely have to hit up!
author: Maya W.

description: A fun late night, underground sushi place... love that they have a giant jar of peanut butter behind the sushi bar for use in rolls.... so.... delicious!
author: C V.

description:
Greeted by all the waitstaff with an animated irashayimase, it was a hospitable welcome in this very authentic Japanese sushi restaurant.

Ryoko opens promptly at 6, no reservations.

I sat at the sushi bar, but this place is deceivingly spacious with upstairs and downstairs seating.

I ordered the maguro again to compare it's freshness with Umami...just as tasty! Then the salmon, mango, and avocado roll wrapped in soy paper, the perfect amount of food for one person. I liked that I was also served a small plate of edamame without asking (or being billed ;)).

And then the drumroll...ice cream mochi. One red bean, one green tea...the ice cream was frozen with the soft mochi cake on the outside, wonderful end to the meal!

My second time back and I don't even live here ;)
author: Jess K.

description:
Friend: Can't wait to go to this place. We have to get the volcano roll! 
Me: What is that? 
Friend: Spicy peanut butter roll! 
Me: WHAT? Are you joking? 

What the heezy? They actually have a roll that has peanut butter in it! I was a bit skeptical to try it at first but it was actually pretty good! For anybody who is a fan of peanut butter has to try this roll out. Besides the volcano roll, I had a couple of their other rolls, the 49er, pokeman, and the sexy mama. They were all decent and tasted fine but compared to the volcano roll they all seem so "normal."   Between a group of 4 girls we pretty much devoured all the rolls in less than 2 minutes a roll. For $30/person I wasn't hungry but wasn't stuffed. 

Placed was packed for a Saturday night so reservations are highly recommended.  For such a crowded place I was surprised by how fast the service was. They got us drinks right away and all the sushi rolls came fairly quickly. Waitress was attentive and got us everything we needed for such a large group. I was pretty happy for a place I never heard anything about. I have to try the sashimi next time!
author: Jenny H.

description: I Like the vibe here. Come mid-week. Sit at the sushi bar. Drink sake. Eat nigiri. Rock on.
author: Anthony R.

description:
Man this spot was the hit a couple years ago. I feel like service has gone down when it gets crazy at late hours.

Barely can get any service at nighttime. Dishes are still pretty good quality, but often times they sell out of many items.  

Got amaebi and they didn't derve me the fried heads.. I mentioned it and they said sorry and took a dollar off the dish. WEAK. 

Pretty pricy too, otherwise I'd give it a 4 still
author: Tim T.

description:
Crunchy crab roll = the best thing i have ever eaten in my life!

I can no longer enjoy sushi at any other place, nothing tastes as fresh!
author: Heather E.

description:
[Reviewed by Kel]

Deep house beats with my sushi? Why, yes, thank you.

This sushi spot is stationed in what looks like the remains of an old dive bar that closed up shop and forgot to take the DJ with them. Bring a dinner date here and walk through the entrance down a flight of steep stairs. Enter into a dark, cavernous room. In the corner, the DJ spins rhythmic tunes. The wait staff seats you and your date on chairs that are a little too low at tables that are a little too close to the hipsters eating sashimi next to you.

No matter. Because once you taste the fish, you won't even notice the loud music ringing in your ears or the bad first date conversation you're having. The fish here is fresh and delicious. Rolls are small, but tasty. Even the menu items (salads and appys) are good.

Prices will make your eyebrows raise, especially for the tiny size of the rolls. Beware, because it adds up quickly. So, if you do bring a date, bring a worthy one.
author: Kel S.

description: Hip, crowded, and divey in a really cool kind of way.  Kind of expensive, but the sushi is good!
author: Madeline M.

description:
This used to be my favorite sushi bar in the neighborhood. So I naturally wanted to eat there for my birthday & introduce it to the out of town friends. 

We were literally no more than 6 minutes late for our reservation (I had tried to call but the line was continually busy) and they told us our reservation was cancelled. 

I asked if we could be moved to the top of the waiting list, as we made a reservation but were late due to the murderous  situation that is downtown parking...they told us no, we'd have to wait at the bottom of the list, 45-60 minute wait.  

happy birthday to me :(
author: Kyle F.

description:
Other than the long wait, this place is awesome!
I checked this place out with my friends because it's right around the corner from my apartment and we really enjoyed it!
The rolls are a bit on the small side and a bit expensive, but definitely worth it! I don't really remember which rolls we ordered but they were all really good and they come out super fast! 
For the three of us, we ended up ordering 5 rolls, 1 tempura, and 1 tonkatsu all for around $70. 
The sushi chef was super chill and everyone seemed super friendly. 
It's really cute how everyone welcomes someone new that enters the restaurant in Japanese. 

I'll definitely be back!
author: Julia K.

description: Delicious fish and great ambiance.  First time I've had sushi while a DJ was spinning on the other side of the room.  Packed even late on a Friday night.
author: Tom K.

description:
What a cool cool place. Went here our first night in San Francisco with my girlfriend for a late night dinner. Walked into a cool basement area with a live DJ and a nice bar. They were playing random rap from the early 00s that reminded me of my high school heyday. I think I tried every alcoholic 
beverage on the menu, and they all went down well.

Oh, and the sushi? It was DAMN good. Inventive menu, good prices. Free edamame on your table. Great vibes. Get the owner to please open up shop on the west coast. I find myself wanting to go to a place like this all the time. Problem is, Ryoko's is one of a kind.
author: Joe T.

description: I would highly recommend this place if you are a sushi fan and find yourself in San Francisco. They have a lot of other places to compete with around town but they hold their own. A fun filled place, make sure to show up early if you don't plan on making reservations, this place gets packed! They are open Late which is also a huge plus for late night sushi lovers.
author: Jeff W.

description: Awesome late night spot in the city. Went last night after a long day of work and it was just what I needed. Awesome rolls, good background music, and surprising good service. I got the Checkerboard roll and the Pokemon roll and they were both delicious!
author: Cristina D.

description:
Came here on a Friday night for a double date. The wait wasn't all that bad and the room was definitely worth it! we ended up getting this little private room big enough for ten for us four and we had a blast! We only decided to do sushi because we wanted to do sake bombs and we most definitely did. It was a ton of fun but not exactly the right kind of vibe to get crazy and drink the night away.
Personally, I thought the rolls were mediocre. They really weren't all that uunique or tasty. The boys seemed to enjoy their food all together, but I honestly have had much better. 
It was great to be with good company but would have been better with good food.
author: Tammy T.

description:
I had a date in the city and chose this place because it was close to Powel Bart, close to Suite 181 and Ruby Skye. I got there about 7:45 which was a perfect time because by 8:15 there were about 10 people standing waiting for somewhere to sit.

It had a club like feel to it with a DJ. But it wasn't too loud to have a conversation.

The food was very good and the men preparing it made it seem like an art.

I'll bring my friends back to this place. It was awesome.
author: Meg T.

description:
I discovered Ryoko's Japanese restaurant with a friend a few weeks back. She is a regular at the restaurant and I was quite excited to see what she was raving about. Once we walked into this little gem near Union Square, I knew I was in sushi fun fun heaven. We went on a Tuesday night, not a normal happening night at Ryoko but the vibe was still happening and hip. One reason the atmosphere was so fun was every time a customer entered the restaurant, the entire staff said, "hello and welcome" in Japanese. It wasn't your normal boring "hello" but a sort of sing song whimsical "hello" found in a Disney princess movie. Every time the staff greeted a new customer, I couldn't help but smile. 

Ryoko's has to be the most hip and happening sushi restaurant in San Francisco. For 23 years they have perfected the sushi experience and it shows. They are open 7 days a week from 6pm to 2am. It's a great late night healthy snack alternative to pizza or a burrito. Plus on Thursday, Friday and Saturday night they have live DJ spinning in the restaurant. 

The sushi and sashimi is super fresh, flown in from Japan and other spots around the world. They offer a daily specials menu with exciting rolls as well as fresh catches. The sushi menu has some amazing rolls with creative SF names such as Spicy Golden Gate, Alcatraz and Humboldt. The bar has a wide selection of hot and cold sake plus a full bar for cocktails and mixed drinks, a rarity in a sushi restaurant. 

I will definitely be back to this neighborhood gem. Word of advice make a reservation or arrive right at 6pm or else you will be stuck waiting for a table. This place is hot and the crowds rarely diminish even in the late hours.
author: Alice S.

description: My husband and I went to Ryoko's and we loved it! Excellent quality and much more reasonable than some of the more expensive sushi restaurants. We sat at the counter and Sushi cheff(Atsusi?) gave us good recommendation. Sanma and Hamachi toro were so delicious! Creamy and flavorful but not fishy at all. I'm so glad we live near by!
author: Tomoco I.

description:
This was my first night back since my not-so-hot experience about a year ago. Now that it's right around the corner from my apartment, I thought it was time to give it another go. 

The experience was all around better than it was before. The service was better and I ordered this delicious fried unagi/avocado roll that I was very impressed with. I've had a lot of eel rolls and that was probably one of the best I've had. It was served with a sweet chili sauce that added a tasty twist on your typical rock n' roll.

I didn't realize it was open so late...!
author: Julia N.

description:
A friend of mine always raves about this place and says that it's the best sushi in the city. So, after unsuccesfully making it to Ryoko's the first time around, I knew I had to give it another try. This time we got our reservation in early so we wouldn't have to wait as long as most do. 

Once we were seated, we looked at the menu and all the different rolls. I'm really basic and safe when it comes to ordering sushi, so I ordered the California rolls and hot tuna. My boyfriend ordered the volcano roll and checkerboard roll for the first round. I loved both of my rolls and the volcano roll was really yummy. I was hesitant because the thought of peanut butter in sushi was odd, but I really enjoyed it. For the second round, we had the crunchy crab, jumping tuna, and another order of california rolls. Crunchy crab was definitely my favorite out of those.

The service was great - our waitress was really attentive and sweet. She talked us into ordering dessert when we didn't think we could eat anymore, but it was actually a great idea. We had the tempura ice cream and it was yummy! 

I will definitely be back! I think I found my favorite sushi restaurant... :)

+They have a DJ!
author: Stephanie C.

description: 2-star food at 4-star prices. Not worth it. Spend your hard-earned money elsewhere. Unless your out late in the area.
author: Inigo M.

description: I loved the food!! The sashimi was very fresh and tasty (in my opinion a reliable indicator of whether a sushi restaurant is really good or not). I had the blue fin tuna, and salmon, octopus sashimi. The sushi rolls were also very flavorful. The Pokemon is one of my favorite rolls because of the refreshing taste of the fresh salmon with mango and avocado wrapped in lettuce and soy paper. I would recommend this place for young and older adults since the restaurant is pretty small and often has soft rock-like music playing and a live dj.
author: Tasaday L.

description:
i LOVE this place.

Found it via Yelp while I was in SF looking for sushi. Had to wait about 30 minutes, but it was worth it. Sushi was great and the atmosphere was wonderful. 

It's a bit dark in the back rooms but that's ok. 

The fish was fresh and good quality and they have a good selection of Sake.
author: Joshua G.

description: Sushi a the bomb! Service was ok but they were slammed so I understood. But, it was so hot!!!!! AC please.
author: Dr J.

description: Just loved this place. Food is amazing and stellar service! I really wanted to go here every night in San Fran. There rolls are awesome and the hamachi is just delicious!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
1 less star only because I think its an awesome sushi joint with fresh fish - but just not the best i ever had (back in NYC).  It is a fun place - and enjoyed meeting Wataru-san, sushi chef from Tokyo.  Awesome guy, let us try some REAL Japanese style sushi plates.  

Try their "home made - Salmon Roe" - delicious. 

again fun place to be, laid back, and good sushi chefs.
author: Ajay P.

description:
After a flash mob during a week day,  a big group of us decided to go here.  The restaurant was really dim and sorta romantic, I guess.  We were definitely the loudest group there. 

We sat down and ordered drinks and our rolls.  The rolls were mreh, I've definitely had a better spicy tuna roll, and for a much better price, though, I did like the addition of the shiso.  We also had rounds of sake bombs.  The sake bombs were super fun, cause we were so loud, and came with smaller cups so you could do it multiple times.  

Overall, it was the people that made it fun, not necessarily the food.  It was ok, but not great.
author: Elaine S.

description:
I came here for a friend's birthday. I've worked in the downtown area for four years and never stumbled upon this place until my friend introduced me, she lives in the Nob Hill area.

The environment's completely laidback - dim lighting, loud up-beat music blasting, and plasmas at the bar from what I recall. It's great if you're with your girlfriends looking to sake bomb. However, if you're a sushi snob or a complete Japanese food connoisseur, this place will fall short of satisfaction. It's completely generic, think healthy Californian Cuisine with a Japanese twist. Not to the discredit of the restaurant, their food IS good . 

(The rating teeters between 3.5 and 4 but I'm generous) :)
author: Annie L.

description: It's not Traditional Japanese Sushi, but it tastes fairly fine even from Japanese point of view.  Ryoko's beer also tastes good.
author: Minako K.

description:
Now, I am not a great big fan of sushi to begin with so I was a litle hesitant.

When we walk in the atmosphere imediately made me feel welcomed cuz the whole staff greeted us as we entered. Service was prompt, and did not have to wait too long for our food, prices were resonable, and ambiance kinda was cool. There is a fried chicken appitizer on the menu which we tried, it was flavorful, but it would of been better if it was made with all white meat.

When we left, the staff all said something in Japanese, I think it was like thank you or goodbye. I would definately go back, mostly because I thought that was a good touch.

Oh and the jumping tuna was good too.
author: Basilio W.

description:
I took a family member who was in town for a conference here for dinner and was disappointed. The ambiance is still young, hip, working professional but service and portion went down considerably.

We initially ordered 4 rolls and a large beer. I was expecting the rolls to come on two plates. It came on one because the portions were that small. So we ordered another 2 rolls. The tally was $80-ish and my stomach was not content.
author: Tony N.

description:
As an avid sushi eater from NYC, I was very disappointed last night when I visited this place.

Both the food an service lacked in quality and thoughtfulness.

The service was horrendous. There seemed to be one waitress working and we hardly saw her. She refilled my drink only halfway and when I asked for more she ignored me. She put these small dishes for us with no explanation and did not put one in front of each of us. The food took forever to arrive (maybe 15-20 which is an eternity by NYC sushi standards).

When the food did arrive my Alcatraz roll was dusted in a skunky brown powder. Te whole plate smelled sour. Everything tasted a bit sour as well (Volcano and Alcatraz rolls). Super gross. My friend who had eaten and just came to hang out with us got a salad. Ate 2 bites and pronounced it disgusting. Who messes up a green salad? This place sucked and was disappointing. Can't wait to eat the good stuff when I get home.
author: Carol F.

description:
How to describe the wonder that is Ryoko's? Went on a Monday night after finding that my flight was cancelled, got in the city late and needed a bite. It was just down the street from where I was staying and also one of the first places to pop up when searching for late night grub in SF. As soon as i walked in I was greeted by a chorus of workers saying "Oyasuminasen" and was promptly seated at the bar. The place was hopping on a Monday night, the music was going with cool lounge with a solid beat, and the workers were all laughing and chatting while still delivering excellent service. I asked for the servers recommendation for the day and he suggested the white tuna tataki (15$) and the Ryoko roll (15$) and a "Ryoko" beer which was a lager with a nice smooth flavour. A stylish middle aged woman was sitting next to me and was quick to make conversation about where I was from and what brought me to this place. Little did i know that the funky woman sitting next to me was none-other than Ryoko herself. Quickly the whole bar seating was all chatting, sushi chef, waiters, everyone joined the fun, and fun it was. Ryoko herself was an absolute pleasure to talk to, had a great relationship with her staff, and just like the roll named after her she seemed so caring flavourful and soft on the outside, and inside was crunchy and fresh, a real gem of a character to meet.
ALL VEGGIES ARE ORGANIC and FISH IS SUPER FRESH!! 
I wish i could give this place more stars but I give it my highest recommendation!

Thank you Ryoko.
author: Giulia L.

description: Picked the spot after some yelp research - and was happily surprised that the sushi was actually better than I expected.  Amazing quality fish - good oysters and not a lot of money spent.
author: David W.

description: Really disliked this place for many reasons. The fish was fresh enough but the quality was sub par.  The hamachi had odd looking ends on the pieces.  It was also chewy.  Ick. The pieces were VERY small.  The maguro was good quality but also tiny.  The rolls were quite limited in the selection. The 2 we ordered were also tiny.  The volcano roll was unbelievably small for 13$. The hot tuna was good.  Was SO dissatisfied.  The reviews are shocking for this sub par sushi... don't get it. At.  All.
author: Bryan M.

description:
Ok, this place has very nice atmosphere, but this is SO expensive!!! it doesn't really worth it!!!! Sushi are fresh, but VERY small! Soooo you spend a lot money and still hungry!!))) I never come back!
One star - for atmosphere and nice music, another one - they open till 2, what is very cool!!!
author: N V.

description:
i gauge the quality of sushi restaurants by their saba (holy mackerel).  

this place has it goin on, the sabagari roll was so fresh, their saba and the homemade ginger was killer good.
author: Kevin W.

description:
well.. the food is okay, but not great.
sushi chef are not Japanese.. so the sushi is just alright,
the line was very long on a Wednesday night..
if you are really into the traditional Japanese sushi, dont come here.
author: Miffy L.

description: I found this place on yelp on my sanfran vacation. Me and the boyfriend were craving some late night food and this place was just a block from our hotel on union square so we decided to see what's up. We ordered a few usual sashimi and the pokemon roll and the sexy roll. The sexy roll is bomb dot com for sure. The sashimi was extremely fresh, and artfully prepared. I wish there was a place this amazing back at home..
author: Emma N.

description:
Hubby and I stumbled upon this last night, while looking for another Sushi place. It was raining and we figured to just go in to get out of the rain and see what happens.

AMAZING!!! The food was awesome. We ordered a lot of food, but probably the best roll we ordered was the Pokemon. The Philadelphia roll (a standard that I always order--yeah I'm a loser) was the best I ever tasted and I totally wasn't expecting that. 

Service was good and yeah, I loved the house music!
author: Erica S.

description:
It's been over a year and I'm still a fan!  This time I also got to try their sake and was surprised to finally come to the realization that I'd rather have hot sake than cold.

The music didn't seem as loud this time...which only proves that my last review was accurate. ;0)
A little scary coming down the stairs from the restroom in that state btw

Service was great and sushi just the light late snack that I was needing.  It will continue to be my go-to place after hours!
author: Ninja H.

description:
The boyfriend and I went here for a late night dinner while visiting San Francisco. The food was great and the atmosphere was perfect for a low key Friday.  On the weekends they have a DJ and although I thought it might be too loud for a chill night out, the volume was just right and the tunes were eclectic. He even played "Can't Deny It" by Fabolous.

The appetizer special that night was bacon wrapped shrimp which the waitress ensured us was really good. They were not only good, they were AMAZING. The bacon was crispy and PERFECT, and the shrimp was super fresh.The jumping tuna roll was another highlight of the meal The crispy cucumber accompanying the tuna worked well with the crunchy fried outside. It was served with a sweet and sour sauce that just made the entire roll pop in my mouth.

Ryoko's is the perfect combination of yummy food, good music, fun atmosphere, and a nice staff. Definitely a must-eat when visiting the great city of SF!
author: Beki S.

description:
Last minute choice to bring a DJ from Amsterdam who's a "pescatarian".  
((4 stars for the stuff I did try and 3 as to not over rate since my experience was limited due to time contraints.))

I yelped this place and read numerous reviews about long waits.  Upon descending down the stairs there was 3 groups of about 2-4 people.  For some reason as we stood on the stairs waiting to be called next, the groups just upped and left.  How long did they wait?  Why did they leave? Who cares?!  We were now next on the list.  The hostess said we had a few more minutes and suggested the bar.  We decided to sit at the bar since there was only three of us and we had to eat and cut since the DJs had a gig at Supperclub later that night.  

The fish was fresh and quality was superb.  I really liked the sushi nigiri 7 piece.  I like how the wasabi is potent and not weak/mild.  I thought the miso  soup was perfect.  Their CA roll was nicely crafted and was very good.  I wish we had time to try all the rolls.  

The service was great, very professional.  The sushi chef we sat in front of was very cordial and although we didn't know it, he was eavesdropping on our conversation about electronic music and dj'ing.  He jumped in on our conversation and was delighted to know that there were two dj's across from him.  He reminisced about 1015...13 years ago??!!  Holy schmit this guy used to party.  Anyhow, he expressed his love for electronic music and also made sure our food was beyond satisfaction.

I'd go back again and sit at a table, take my lovely time and try more items from the menu.
author: Nancy P.

description:
Gotta love when you have that impromptu trip to the city and Yelp comes to your rescue on a killer sushi spot, within walking distance! This is definitely not for the sushi infusion lovers! This is more for cool ambience and traditional sushi dishes.

A couple things: girl DJ (always awesome!) and smooth, clean flavors in the sushi. I loved loved the fried cheese and the sashimi choices. One star lost because they didn't have 2-3 items that I ordered. All in all, I'll be back.
author: Ana M.

description:
Good place for sushi in the SF area. Had to wait for 30 minutes since we had 9 people in our party, but it was very well worth the wait.

Service is incredible! The sushi looks really good, but a bit on the smaller side, and price is average-high. Couldn't eat any sushi, I gave up rice for lent, but preparation and presentation of the food is A+.

Sake is really cheap, they offer a XL hot sake for $10! We must've ordered 5 bottles at least! Pitchers of sapporo too, score! If you come with a large party, they have secluded rooms! Good experience here, I'd come back for the sushi! The noise is a bit overwhelming, but tolerable.
author: Ronald S.

description:
I came here with some expectations.  I came here with a girlfriend and she said Ryoko's got pretty good reviews on yelp.  Customer service was great.  When you walk in and when you leave, all the wait staff greets you in Japanese.

We ordered the Grilled Onigiri, Onigiri with Salmon, Volcano Roll, Hot Tuna Roll, Spicy Scallop Roll and Hot Mama Roll.

The Onigiri rolls were just okay.  The Grilled Onigiri Roll was good with soy sauce.  The Onigiri roll with Salmon was kind of disappointing.  The Salmon wasnt on the whole roll.  It felted like they just dumped it on.  The Salmon was cooked.  I wished it was raw.  There wasnt much flavor to the salmon.

The rolls didnt have much flavor.  The rolls didn't have enough fish in them.  There was a lot of rice.  After the four rolls, we felt like they all tasted the same.  

I wish we could have liked this place....
author: Carol K.

description:
I planned a birthday dinner here even though myself or anyone else had never been here before. I definitely recommended making a reservation. This place gets packed but it's not too loud, so you can still hear the people you're talking to. The food was delicious. I ordered three sushi rolls, the Philadelphia, crab and cucumber and the BBQ eel.
This place was reasonably priced for the quality of food they had. My group also ordered a pitcher of beer and two jars of cold sake and it was the perfect amount of drinks for 6-7 people. 
I loved the music that the DJ was playing.

I already want to go back!
author: Stephanie U.

description: A 2.5 for me. I saw so many reviews so I was expecting something good. I had a big party so we waited 2 hours on a Tuesday,  which was fine since it was a small place.... if the food was worth it. The sushi bar was backed up for what they said hours so people weren't leaving and their menu is mainly sushi so it took forever for people to eat and leave. If you had a small party, you get seated in about 30 min. The waitress were nice and made waiting bearable but lets talk about the food. I was very disappointed. I had much better quality elsewhere for a fraction of the price. The rolls were interesting but were falling apart and that's a big no no. For the price of roughly $10 we got 5 pieces per roll which is ridiculous. Nothing special. I don't understand the hype. I would not go back.
author: Shirley Y.

description:
I love love love this place. They are open late, and have amazing food.
It's usually busy, but I don't mind the wait.
The sushi is always fresh and the service is excellent.
I've had birthday parties, romantic dinners, and late night snacks here. 
It's also a good place to bring your parents to, which my boyfriend and I both have done!
I really don't have anything bad to say about this place. You should go there now!
author: Adrienne A.

description: By far, the absolute best sushi in San Francisco! The owners are amazingly hospitable, the waiters are extremely nice. Back to the food--it's all organic. I've tried all the specials on the board, and all I have to say is one word, "yum"!
author: Cindy L.

description: Don't listen to that Nate guy a couple reviews down! Service here is amazing as well as the food. One of the best run places I have been in a long time.  The waitress/hostess kicks ass! She sat tables as well as took orders, AMAZING. Fresh fish, great rolls. Favorite would be the 49ER'S roll! 10 stars all around. Do not pass up this gem.
author: Samantha H.

description: Nothing seems appealing. The food was decent, but not memorable for me to come back and the location is in a weird area. Overall, this restaurant is great for a late night dinner, bars, or if anyone is craving for some sushi; since they open pretty late. I would only give them 3 stars an a half because of the inconvenience location and the loudest in the restaurant.
author: Vivian S.

description: This place is always worth the wait, as they don't take reservations. That said, I love the NYC vibe, DJ and delicious sushi. I am never disappointed, nor are the many friends I take to this SF local restaurant.
author: Jay R.

description:
Wow. What is everyone smoking?

This food was okay. Skip it, there are much better places in SFO.
author: Matthew C.

description: Probably the best sushi I've ever had in my life (no lie). We pretty much devoured everything we ordered. The DJ was playing good music and the waitress and sushi chefs were friendly.
author: Veronica H.

description:
What a cool little sushi joint in San Francisco...  It's hip, it's comfy, the service is very friendly, and the sushi is fresh and delicious!

The piano was a nice touch.... although it was only used as a table for the live dj and her equipment.  

The constant greetings in Japanese by the entire staff whenever someone arrived or departed was a nice little touch that every customer seemed to appreciate and admire.  

I also appreciated their late hours.  Open til 2am...  Sweet!

For those who drive to this place, there is a convenient and cheap valet parking lot right behind this building next to Le Colonial Restaurant.
author: Danny L.

description: I wanted to like them. The food was good, not fantastic, but they don't accept phone orders and make takeout a painfully difficult.  I'll find another takeout place in the neighborhood.
author: Jay C.

description:
Craving sushi really late at night? Check this place out. Even though it was only 10:30pm, we wanted to come here just because we knew they close at 2am and always wanted to try it.

From the moment you walk down those stairs, you're greeted by the whole staff! This place makes you believe you're in Japan and part of their nightlife.

The food was very fresh and their menu had a lot of rolls ranging from $5-$13. 

We ordered:
Hotate nigiri- scallops topped with a little tobiko, very fresh
Sushi roll-big chunks of sushi per bite. Yum. 
Volcano roll-tomago, tempura shrimp, jalepeno pepper, peanut butter-this was the first time I've ever tried something like that and the flavors worked well together. Quite spicy! Hence the name. 

Again, their staff is soooo friendly and genuinely deliver great hospitality. Your glass is rarely empty. You'll end up walking out hearing the gang say good bye along with your sushi chef saying farewell like three different times!  

I would definitely come back next time I want sushi really really late at night. 

Tip: Parking is hard to find. Go here late night, it's a good vibe with a DJ.
author: Johanna P.

description: May be a little bit of a wait when you get here, but it's very well worth it. I came here with a friend and we couldn't get enough of their food. I ordered a clam miso soup and two orders of rolls, which were perfect! The fish is as fresh as it gets, and the taste combination is very sophisticated. Each roll was about $7 with 5 pieces in each. I would totally come back for a roll fiest with friends.
author: Renata G.

description: Jumping Tuna is unique, but Pokemon is not so much. They should put some sauce on their grilled ika!
author: Gianni C.

description:
Came on a Sunday with my friends who just flew in from Europe.

We actually came here because of other yelp reviews.  Bummer for us.

The sushi was ok, although the uni was fresh.

Tell me why the DJ had to pump up the beats and then invite all his raver buddies to the restaurant even though they were not eating and just chillin, and homeboy wearing the cookie monster suit, well actually that was pretty cool, just not when Im trying to eat my sushi and catch up with my buddies you e-tard!

Still on the hunt for good sushi in the bay....suggestions?
author: Richard N.

description:
This rating is based on our experience and preference of environmental aesthetics. Others will see it differently.

We weren't super hungry so we just ordered the Yakitori and Rainbow Roll. I'm use to high quality, great portions, and pretty good prices. The quality of the fish was actually really great, but the portions and prices..EH not so great. I do have to say that maybe we just ordered the wrong thing? But my boyfriend feels that a great place shouldn't have a hit or miss menu.

So, like I've said... The raw items were really good. I just found the portions to small compared to other places I have gone to and also price wise. The Yakitori had only two skewers... tiny skewers at that. Not very good either. 

The sushi seem very small too. Idk about where people go but paying $30+ for just two items was a little intense for me. We ate the two items within five minutes. I pay less or just as much as this at the place near my house for a HUGE/great portioned bento w/ soup/salad, sushi, drinks and great quality. 

The environment wasn't for us. I guess we mainly just like white noise in the background or just people talking... This place was dark and had loud music. I guess if you want sushi and sorta want a club scene, then this is your place. This could be a place to meet someone? Now that I think about it, it's not a place for a couple to hang out and talk. It's more of a place where a group of friends would like to eat, talk very loudly to one another, and get wasted :D

Well, maybe we got the wrong items but I don't think we will be coming back here again. We actually waited here a year ago but the line was a long wait and ended up going down the street to another sushi place. I will say that the service was good ;D

I don't know if there is a way for a person in a wheel chair to get in here... the entrance is a steep stairway.
author: Stephanie B.

description: Great late night sushi in San Fran:) enjoyed the friendly service and quick food:)
author: Laura W.

description:
Came here on a Friday night with friends to chill and instantly became a fan. They have a great selection of sashimi (more so than a lot of SF sushi restaurants) and the fish is always fresh. Beware as 2 pieces of nigiri can easily cost you ~$9, but the quality of the fish definitely makes up for it. 

If you are looking for good value, then get their rolls. I recommend volcano & dragon rolls. they put peanut butter in volcano roll - sounds ridiculous but it's surprisingly a good combination. as for sashimi i recommend white tuna & hamachi toro. a lot of their food is Americanized (ie. rolls) but they also offer daily specials which consist of authentic Japanese dishes 

The crowd tends to be more yuppie oriented and everyone is there to have a good time after a long day/week. They have live DJ towards later part of the night, they usually play hip-hop/house music. This place is not your typical prim and proper Japanese restaurant type of setting - but more of a hangout spot with upscale bar food (ie. sushi) for a night-out to chillax with good music, food, and company!
author: Melody L.

description:
It was not my first time here. My last time was about couple years ago and I still remember that the food was pretty good. 

My friend and I came there around 11:00pm on Sunday for late night sushi. The restaurant was about half full. The service was warm and friendly. Since it was Sunday, they did not have live DJ that night. 

We ordered: 

Pokemon Roll - It was salmon, mango, avocado, and green leaf lettuce and wrapped with soy paper. I don't like this one at all. The roll was not wrapped tightly. The mango tasted weird in this roll, not a good combination. 

Shitake Roll (Cooked Japanese mushroom) - This one was ok. I don't think anyone can mess up this simple roll. 

Tiger - It was shrimp tempura, cucumber and mayonnaise. 

Checkerboard - It was crab and avocado with tuna and yellow tail on top. Seriously, the fish was not that fresh. All the rolls tasted very similar even they were different. 

Overall, this is an OK place if you crave for sushi at late night and want something different from the traditional Japanese restaurant.
author: Liza T.

description:
First of all, THERE'S PEANUT BUTTER IN THE VOLCANO ROLL. And I, of course, had to try it. And, of course, it was delicious. Mainly, because anything with peanut butter in it is delicious. But in all seriousness, this roll was awesome.

Their Jumping Tuna roll (and I presume the other "Jumping" rolls) are alright.. they are apparently the most popular rolls ordered, but I thought they were pretty heavy and tasted like they were over-battered and fried. Very...doughy. 

All in all, the sushi was ok, but I didn't really see what all the craze was about. I still maintain that Akiko's on Mason is the best sushi in San Francisco.
author: Lauren F.

description:
one of the better sushi places I've ever been and surprisingly not overpriced despite it's location near Union Square.  Great food and overall experience. Everything we tried was tasty and did not disappoint at all

We got there right before the rush and the place stayed filled with about 10+ people waiting. Not sure if they take reservations or not but I will definitely be back during my next visit (hopefully this summer).
author: Daniel A.

description: Met a friend here for dinner while in SF. I thought everything was top notch. We walked in at 7 and were seated immediately. Had the monkfish liver but didnt care for it. Not sure about the reference to foie, but maybe it was the way they prepared it. Seaweed salad was well received as were all the rolls we had (49ers, hot tail, and crunchy crab). I'd love to go back for more.
author: Mike M.

description:
I've come here countless times and can't believe that I haven't wrote a review until now.  Ryoko's is anything but your average sushi joint.  It is without a doubt my favorite late night sushi place to eat in The City, and is on my list of top sushi places in SF.

Yes, there can be a wait, even at 1am - but it's certainly worth waiting for - from the time you walk down the stairs into this almost hidden, underground, jem and the wait staff shouts out greeting you in Japanese.  Then, throughout your dining, and drinking experience, as you walk up the stairs emerging from the underworld, full of tasty sushi, and thinking, yes it's great to live in THE foodie capital of the US - and then the wait staff shouts thanks and have a great night, in Japanese, cementing the experience as a great one that must be repeated.

Ryoko's is downtown, in Nob Hill, so take MUNI or BART.  Street parking can be tough, but if you're willing to shell out buck$$$ there is a hidden parking lot adjacent, in the small alleyway.

They have a large selection of food and rolls, as well as daily specials up on a whiteboard behind the sushi bar.  Weekends they have a live DJ so if you're looking for a fancy, upscale, quiet intimate place, this would not be your place.  It can get a bit loud at times.  The sushi is always fresh and tastes amazing.  The service is friendly, typically fast and attentive, especially considering they are almost always busy, or full.  If there's only two in your party, and you don't mind sitting at the bar, chat up the chefs, buy them a drink, and watch them concoct up some amazing masterpiece for your taste buds to savor.  Or just watch them do it for someone else.  

Food = 5 Stars
Drinks = 5 Stars
Service = 4 Stars
Ambiance = 4.5 Stars

If you're looking for great, fresh, sushi and a fun time then Ryoko's is the place to go.  Great, fresh, sushi, sake / full bar, great tunes, great ambiance and great times.
author: Bryan D.

description:
My favorite spot in town.Their sushi is heavenly delicious and the staff is always so friendly. Whether you get a table or drop in for the bar, the place has the energy! Don't be turned down by the long wait during the rush hour - it's so worth it.  

Love their DJs on the  weekends, this makes it a perfect hang-out place.
author: Marienne L.

description: I had to write a review to refute some of the reviews on here. My husband and I were on our honeymoon when we stumbled upon Ryoko's sushi and we were so happy with this place, we ate here 2 nights in a row. I've been to really good, fancy sushi restaurants in NYC, in LA, and even some hidden sushi restaurants in the plazas of Thai Town, and I can tell you that this place lives up to some of the best sushi I've had around. That being said, I mean that for the nigiri sushi/sashimi since those were what we thought were best--and I mean delectable fish--especially the tuna belly--so fresh and to die for! It melts like butter in your mouth. Def a place to eat good sushi if you're into fresh fish!!!!  If I could, I would give this place 4.5 stars since the sushi chef who made our rolls was also very accommodating.
author: Ailene E.

description:
Update: the last few times I was in the douchebag dude was gone.  So I'm bringing the review up to 4 stars.  I would give it 5 except it's kind of loud in a way that seems not necessary.  Like lowering the music a tad and a little bit of acoustical treatment wouldnt hurt.  But other than that, it's the best low-key, late-night, casual atmosphere sushi place in the city.  See my former review below:

I would give this place 5 stars for the quality of the fish alone.  I am a frequent customer who spends $100 per meal at this place on a regular basis. No skimping when I'm in the mood for good sushi.  And recently I've been very annoyed by another regular customer who is served far too much beer and who is permitted to stay and bother single female customers who just want to eat their expensive meal in peace just like any self-respecting businessman would.  The restaurant continues to serve him way too much beer despite his slurred speech, stumbling walk, and harassment of customers.  I have seen him there several times being unpleasant and embarrassing
.  He needs to be banned.  If I continue to see him there heavily drinking not only will I stop giving this restaurant my business but I will update this review with 1 star and also update my review to advise that attractive young women should avoid this place because they cater to disrespectful drunk older men.

Restaurants and bars: if you want attractive single women to come spend serious money at your establishment, don't cater to cheap drunk douchebags who buy pitchers of beer but not much else and scare off your more desirable customers.
author: katie s.

description: I adore this place. It's the sushi equivalent of my favorite neighborhood dive bar.
author: Aman V.

description:
I believe most of us have had that moment where Yelp introduced us to something new and fantastic...that happens to be right around the corner.  Ryoko would be that perfect example for me.  We were at Le Colonial enjoying some drinks when we decided that Japanese food would hit the spot (when does it not?).  I took out my phone, did a little search and found Ryoko - 4 stars out of 500 reviews.  A pretty solid indication that this place was going to rock.

And of course, my fellow Yelp-writers were not wrong!  This place is not only cute - I love that you have to descend the stairs to arrive to the shouts of "irashaimase" - the food is good. 

Highly recommend the grilled squid.  It arrives all chopped up and ready for consumption...with a side of mayo.  No, really.  Get it.  The rolls and sashimi were also good, as good as any other decent sushi place.  Rolls weren't terribly pricey, they ranged from $6-$10.  Oh, and if you saved room for dessert, you can't go wrong with the green tea mochi. The mochi is perfectly soft, and the ice cream is just melty icy goodness.

Definitely one of my favorites in the city -- if not my favorite of them all!
author: Shay F.

description:
If you come here, add contingency time. I've been here twice and the service has been very slow.

They have a variety of sushi, which I've found ok.

Cool blue club ambiance. Open late.
author: Cathy K.

description:
This place blew me away: the location, the restaurant itself, and most importantly the food.

My girlfriend and I ordered some gyoza, yakitori, tempura, and a bunch of rolls and nothing was short of phenomenal. Food was fresh and delicious and the atmosphere was perfect. I cannot wait to visit this place again.
author: Nick W.

description:
Summary:
Loud and dirty environment with above average pricing and average Japanese food. 

Details:
Took my gf here as part of her birthday weekend, after our plan A restaurant was closed on Sunday.  Well, we quickly found a Yelp 4-stars alternative with the iphone and trusted our Yelpers to bring us to the next best sushi place.  Yelp, I trusted you and you broke my heart... 

Ambiance 
Instead of the usual classy Zen-like Japanese place or cozy sushi bar, Ryoko is more like a dark lounge/bar, completed with bathroom smell and stained carpets and sofa.  The music was so loud that I could barely hear my gf talking...  The menu is sticky and looks very old. (and I never care about the quality of menu...)  

What we ordered
$31 for a sashimi deluxe (a small plate of typical raw fishes, with above average price tag)
$12/$6/$8 for some nigiri special that used fishes from Japan (average taste with Japan premium)
$2x3 for green tea and barley tea (really...?)

After $75 in, we quickly left the place and moved on with our lives.  With this kind of price tag, we could've gone to so many other nice/cute/classy sushi joints in SF.  It's mind boggling how this place got its 4 stars...
author: Michael L.

description:
I'm a little torn because I don't know if I should give this place 3 or 4 stars. This definitely is a hole in the wall and you definitely feel your cool factor go up a couple notches when you walk in. I liked the food, but I didn't love it. Maybe that's because I was looking for a deal and the bf and I left a little hungry afterwards. 

Don't come here if you are claustrophobic or if you are afraid of the dark. I am a little bit of both. Anyway, I think I'll come back one more time before I can decide if I will up it one more star or not. 

Cool factor: Good muzak and full bar!
author: Lisa T.

description: Great sushi. Noisy and only one bathroom for men and women. Location is very cool. Feels very "undergroundy" (probably because it is *slaps head*)
author: Jason G.

description: I went here for my 24th birthday. I chose it because it was close by where we were going afterwards. I was really disappointed overall.  First of all, it was BURNING hot inside.  I mean literally, we had like 5 fans on our table, and we were all still sweating. Not a good look if you are about to go out! Besides that, I was not impressed with the food at all, I can't imagine how they could possible keep the fish fresh when its 90 degrees inside.  The height of the table was really awkward, the table was the same height as our knees when we were sitting down. The only good things were the table was kind of in its own little private room and they play loud music.
author: Raheleh K.

description: Definitely not worth four stars. This is more of a bar to share drinks and some food with friends. The sushi is acceptable but way way way over-priced (hence two stars). Not anywhere close to best in SF (like other reviews claim). Seriously, if you think this place has great sushi then you are an amateur.
author: Ali P.

description: This was my go to spot for Sushi in the city.  But they no longer take reservations.  There is now a ~1 hr wait to be seated. It's and unfortunate because otherwise, this is a great restaurant with cool ambiance, good food and decent prices.
author: Blaine E.

description: average quality sushi. funky ambiance. if i was ever in SF again and hungry at 1 am I would go.....
author: prianka M.

description:
Fun ambiance.  Went on a Saturday night when they were slammed and service was friendly but really slow.  Didn't try a whole lot.. but I've had better salmon sashimi.... and that's not hard to get right.

Volcano roll - peanut butter in a sushi roll?  Really?  Meh.
author: Lily T.

description:
Ryoko's definitely has character and makes for a hip dining experience.  You walk down a steep flight of stairs into a small blue room.  Dimly lit with loud music (they have a live dj most nights), Ryoko's is great for dates or hanging out with friends. Parents? Not so much.

The sashimi is good, but due to price and teeny portion size, I wouldn't say it is outstanding.  They do have a legitimate selection of seasonal items though, and if you are a sushi buff, I recommend trying the iwashi (sardine) when they have it.  Not only is iwashi delicious, it's sustainable too (unlike bluefin tuna). 

P.S. They are also open till 1 or 2 AM.  You never know when those random sushi cravings'll hit!
author: Irene C.

description: I'm from LA, when I get the chance to come up to SF this place is a must! The wait is ridiculous most of the time because the place isn't that big but it has been worth the wait every time I've made it in.
author: Sylvia D.

description:
Always great! Love it here.  Food and drinks are awesome.  But that's probably because I don't skimp on anything.  I get all my favorites.  I love the fish from Japan, could be pricey but worth it.  Uni is always super high quality.  The Ame ebi is always super sweet and succulent.  
Look on the specials board to find some great stuff.  
i can seriously eat here everyday and not feel bad about it.  The only thing is that I'll need to win powerball or have someone else's bank account.  It won't be cheap to eat everything you want here.
author: Au C.

description:
It blows my mind that this place is packed, and people are waiting on the steps and outside for their tables.  But then again, Nicky Minaj, Real Housewives, mashups, and Jersey Shore are popular too, so what do I know, other than I'm not going to Rykoko's again.  Had to go for a friend's bday.  The music playing was awful, then a guy sets up his computer and controller on the piano.  I won't call him a DJ because there are no discs involved, he just does a lot of pointing and clicking.  His first couple tracks were good, groovy house, and we were all happy with his selections, but it quickly turned to doom, vocoders and dubstep.. why why why do people think this is good, it really feels like my ears are going to start bleeding.
Anyways, the music is crap, funky smells are going on since it's downstairs and doesn't get good ventilation, and the quality of fish is pretty bad.  You're just hoping your not gonna regret it later.  
This place is for people in their 20s, it's "party sushi", They like it because they haven't had better, and that's fine with me. They can have it.
author: Jason D.

description: Small place. Warm, music, on the darker side. Really good quality sushi. Always crowded. Will be coming back.
author: Eric M.

description:
I live in Chicago, but every time I'm in San Francisco I head to Ryoko's. Was just there for about 4 days and went twice... it's that good! 

The fish is super fresh, they always have great specials and the staff is awesome. 

Last night(Saturday) they even had a DJ... weird, but hey it's fun and adds to the experience. Definitely agree that it's kind of a hidden gem, I'd like to steal it from San Francisco and put it in Chicago!
author: Iman J.

description:
This place is awesome! For finding food at 1am, Ryoko's is a gem. I'm not sure if I would hit this place up during the day or early evening, but when your choices are Denny's, Mel's, Ihop, McD's, Jbox, and Na'an and curry, Ryoko's shines in comparison.

They are a bit pricey, but I think it's worth it. I've had a lot of the food here, and I've brought many friends in various stages of belligerence, and I've always been treated nicely. The service is always pretty decent and they have some pretty epic trance tracks playing in the background. 

My favorites here are the soft shelled crab, asari saka mushi (steamed clams), and the sashimi combination. I like coming here with a group of people, because then we can all share food and it is delicious!
author: Grace Y.

description: This place has great tasting, fresh sushi. I went on a Friday and had to wait an hour, but didn't mind since there was stuff going on in Union Square. But if you are in a rush, you probably won't appreciate the wait on weekends. It is pretty cool that this place stays open until 2am.. perfect spot to eat after a night out!
author: Julia K.

description:
It's like a surprise party every time someone opens the door. This is not your typical traditional Japanese Restaurant, you can hear it in the voices of the host, chef, and waitress who greet you when you walk down the stairs. Right when you step foot in Ryoko's, you know this is a fun place to be. The 80's music, dark furnitures, and the piano in the middle of the room. However, the food and quality is ehh okay. They are open till 2 p.m. though.

What we ordered:
MONK FISH LIVER- 4 slices monk fish liver with ponzu sauce. 
KAI MISO SOUP - I can taste the beer in this. yum. And lots of clams.
HOUSE SALAD - Greens with Sesame dressing
SABA SHIOYAKI- Grilled and taste yummy. Generous portion.  I don't like the little fish bones (very few) though. 
UNI, AMAEBI, SAKE - Sashimi were okay, had better elsewhere.
VOLCANO ROLL - Interesting because this have peanut butter in it. It's not mind blowing but different.
SPICY SCALLOP - Sweet scallop with a hint of spiciness and shiso (mint) leave

Come early if you want to avoid the long wait. And of course, they won't let you walk out quietly. The chef, host, and waitress shouted "Arigatō and have a good night " as we walked up the stairs. I left with a big smile on my face.
author: Christina W.

description:
I had some friends coming into town that had gotten a hotel in Union Square. I read all the yelp reviews and 4 stars for couple hundred reviews seemed like good odds to me. I was in a group of 7, so I made reservations a week in advance for 8pm on a Friday night. It was busy, and the service was a bit slow, but pretty fast considering every seat in the house was full. Note: this place is open until 2am, so theres no need to rush!

The sushi was more like 3 - 3.5 stars. Reasonably priced but all the rolls we got were only 6 pieces. Yummy to say the least, but not perfection. They did have $12 pitchers of Sapporo so that made up for it. If I am remembering correctly, they didnt have any nigiri on the menu which kind of bummed me out. 

Points for a cool atmosphere! We were seated in this back room that had a mirrored wall and some funky blue paint. It felt like we had our own private dinner but we could still hear to DJ. Not the swankiest place, but a very fun environment. I would definitely go back.
author: Holl T.

description: This is the perfect place to have a pre-show dinner.  I almost always come here before going to the Curran or SF Playhouse.  It's great to have sushi before sitting for 2-3 hours because you don't get sleepy like you do with some other cuisines.
author: Skye W.

description:
To echo most of the other reviews here, Ryoko's is GREAT.

From the friendly greeting and goodbye from the chefs at the bar, the staff make you feel right at home. I've had about half the menu and have yet to try something that hasn't made me want more. Try the Jumping Tuna roll - you will definitely jump from the delicious taste!

I don't agree with the other reviewers who say this place is expensive for what it is - are you kidding?! $7 for a full bottle of sake, $5-$7 rolls (have you been to other SF sushi places?!). I'm a big guy, and can eat a lot. A full meal for 2 will cost you $55 max including drinks & tip. For sushi? And alcohol?! Get outta here!

They play some great music after 9, before that its a little more chill. This is a good weekday place to take someone if you're looking for low-key intimate, and a fun weekend (Thurs-Sat night) place if you want an upbeat crowd. Expect to wait for 30-45 minutes if you don't get there early enough. Also, a warning that it can get a little warm downstairs when there is a big crowd, so dress in layers!

Overall, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
author: Aaron M.

description:
If you are looking for a different type of experience, a place to go with a group, or just a place to do some sake bombs... come here. This place was quite the experience. I have never experienced a crowded sushi place like this before. It was crowded, but it wasn't so crowded where I had to dislike the place.

As for the food, I really enjoyed them, but not the price. The price was kind of high for what they were. I think I would have appreciated them more if there were more portions... this place is more about quality over quantity.

I recommend this place if you are looking for a place to have a good time with friends... and if you want to be loud and drunk.
author: Sonlay V.

description:
Yesterday got 7 rolls:
2 california
2 dragon
1 tahoe roll
1 salmon sushi
1 red spicy tuna
and a bottle of sauvignon blanc
All excellent, their dragon was really good, 
perhaps one of the best sushi restaurant ever eaten.
I was impressed
author: Luca R.

description:
My favorite sushi place ever.  At first I thought it was a weird vibe, painted dark blue inside, pumping music, but it's just fun. They have some areas in the back where you can fit a pretty large group of people for bithdays or whatever, we had somewhere around 15 once, brought a cake, and everything.  

There's some roll with peanut butter in it that I always think of when I think of Ryokos.  Delicious.  Get that one.
author: Muriel D.

description:
Hamachi kama was da bomb!  Open until 2 AM so good for all us folks coming in on the Hawaiian flight, looking for a late night sushi fix.  

Only bummer is the waitress was sick and coughed on our food when bringing it to the table :(
author: George E.

description: There are not enough good things to say about this place! This was without a doubt the best sushi/Japanese I have ever had!  Just a warning this place has an 88 max occupancy, so you will probably have a wait but they do turn tables very quickly.they give you free edamame  for the table. My parents and I had a variety of things from the menu. We had the crunchy crab roll which was delicious, but we also tried something called the sexy roll. This was unlike any roll I had ever had, it was like a California roll but with cooked salmon and melted cheese on top.  The miso clam soup was very good and so was the salads with the sesame dressing. The tempura shrimp was so garlicky but not over powering.  Last but not least the best thing we had was the beef teriyaki..... Oh my word! I know this sounds crazy but this was without a doubt the best tasting beef I have ever had in my life! This place is a hole in the wall but is a total gem!
author: Laura B.

description: Possibly one of the better sushi restaurants in the neighborhood. Flavor, freshness, and presentation is on point. It does bother me that they charge two bucks for green tea. What kind of Asian restaurant charges for tea? When I'm eating chinky Asian cuisine (Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Vietnamese), I expect tea to come to my table along with the menu. That's my biggest complaint. The service can use some improvement. I get it, it's busy, but at times their service is borderline neglect. Would you even notice if I just got up and bounced? I'm saying...!!!
author: Helen L.

description:
Tasty treats. This place is a little hidden gem. A friend told me about it and off we went. My friend happens to know a few employees so we were able to sample a few different items, all of which were very good and different. The variety was probably one of the best I have had at a sushi restaurant. The service was great and the wait, despite the fact that the place was packed, was very short. 

Also, this place has a full bar which is notable considering the cost of a liquor license in this city.

I will be back.
author: Brian R.

description:
there isn't one particular reason for the two-star but more a summation of all of them. 
if you're looking to simply fulfill the sushi void, this will cut it. but if you're looking for a tasty and enjoyable meal, i'm not sure this would be my first pick. 

tried to come here once before and the wait was ridiculous. this time around, we got lucky and a crowd of people came in right after us. the hostess was extremely nice and kept us posted on the wait time. 

the sashimi was decent- we ordred one of the combo plates. one of our salmon pieces had a weird purple discoloration. not sure why or if that part should have been served. i asked the waitress and she said it's fine so i ate it. 
we also ordered a roll which was wrapped horribly. the rice fell apart when we tried to pick it up. the waitor also failed to put in the order somehow. we had to remind him after we had finished the combo plate and had to wait quite long before getting the roll. 
the place also plays house music which is a bit interesting
author: Janet Y.

description: I waited for an hour for a sucky table. We ordered 3 rolls (Volcano, 49'er, and Pokemon). 2 of the "rolls" included just 4-5 small pieces and it cost $13 each roll. To top things off, the fish was warm and the rolls lacked flavor. The only reason this restaurant gets two stars is because of the fast service we got once we were sat. I don't plan on coming back.
author: Crystal R.

description:
I've been here several times, and it never fails to please. Dark, blue, underground. It's like another world. On Halloween, the DJ was wearing a fluffy bunny suit. Win!

Super fresh fish. (so go for the sashimi if you are so inclined!) Delicious rolls to suit any taste. Excellent sake selection. 

A great bar (watch the pros at work) and friendly staff. Plenty of tables in dark (even darker) corners (watch your head!). 

It can get loud. It can get crowded (best is mid-week to avoid the wait and crowd).
author: Boris C.

description:
I love sushi, almost as much as I love peanut butter!  Ryoko added this divine spread of the gods to one of its rolls, fused with jalapeno and tempura, to create one of the best accomplishments of human-kind: the volcano roll.  Sure, sushi has been made spicy with the help of spicy tuna and crab, and those are completely and utterly delicious.  But what about taking a nice, polite and established couple such as spicy food and sushi, and turning that into a raunchy and freaky three-way with some rich and creamy peanut butter?!?! 

Mouth watering yet?  When I learned of the volcano roll, I was drooling.  After partaking in this masterpiece, I can happily say that my expectations were met, and then exceeded.  Peanut butter is truly one of mother earth's most generous gifts, and I thank the chefs of Ryoko for their ingenuity.  I didn't even think about muttering our safe word.

Everything else here is good, too.
author: Matt B.

description:
My bf and I were waiting at Katana-Ya when he yelped this place.  It was a close walk so we decided to try it out (so that I can yelp it afterwards).  

We walked in and down the stairs.  The music was really upbeat and after waiting for several minutes, the waitress came and asked us if we wanted something to drink, very sweet of her.  The place is small so the wait was a bit long.  

They give you free edemame, good to munch on while we waited for our food.  The food was amazing BUT my chirashi regular had veryyy thin slices of fish, probably up to 8 slices for $24!  That was a bit steep but still very good.  Another downer was the limited soft drinks, no free refills! Everything else was amazing.  The oysters were delicious, the sauce and seasoning they used was mouthwatering.  The miso soup was fresh and my bf tried the clams miso soup and he liked it.

I want to come here for more oysters and perhaps try their rolls next time.
author: Phuong H.

description: best. sushi. hands. down. there is a line to get in before they open - def get there early to avoid the wait.
author: lucy p.

description:
Just as good as I remember. Me and my friend got the Chirashi Regular and the 49'ers (Represent!) roll.

Some of the freshest sushi I've ever had, the salmon and tuna are killer. We got in at the right time and secured a great spot, I know this place gets super packed from my previous experience 3-4 years ago (I'm not a local). There's a reason this place has been open 23 years.

Places like this make me wished I lived near SF...
author: Alvin C.

description: Great place, had a plethora of rolls and each of them was very good.  The place was slammed on a tuesday evening at 8pm but the turn over was pretty fast.  Highly recommend.
author: David G.

description: This is my new go-to sushi spot. For starters it's open late and centrally located with plenty of seating, which makes it the most convenient place in town to get Japanese food, but that's just the beginning. The atmosphere is welcoming, the staff is very animated and super friendly, and the dishes they prepare are really fresh, well-textured, and complexly flavored for what they are. I was able to get very exploratory with their menu because everything was just superlative. I even had a California roll that was so good that I ordered a couple extra myself (that's a first). Yes I used to think that roll was the weakest thing you could possibly order at a sushi spot, in fact I rarely ever order rolls of any kind, but their preparation had an unsurpassed quality to it that made it irresistible to a crab, sesame, and avocado lover for a mere five dollars. On my way out I met the owner of the joint just chillin at the bar and it was then I realized why Ryoko is such a pleasant experience, and it starts with her.
author: Rich W.

description:
Excellent sushi place!

Went there on a saturday night, got lucky as we were only 2 and we got seated quite quickly at the bar. Always nice to see the cook work their art.

Sushi are excellent, fresh, tasty, very subtle (not big and greasy as you might find in some other places).

Definitely THE place to go if you want good sushis.

However, it seems this place (which is not that big) gets easily crowded. I guess that's the drawback which comes with the good reputation.
author: Fabien V.

description:
- I hate the wait, but it's worth it.

- Great service from all staff.

- Love the atmosphere and decor of this place.

- Great selection of rolls + love the names of the rolls.

- MY FAVORITE SUSHI PLACE IN THE CITY!!!
author: Rachel J.

description: I've always wondered what lies beneath those two little blue flags, this place looks like it could have been an old speakeasy club in it's past life...dark and below ground. Reminds me of New York too. I felt like I was in a club with the music, it was a bit loud for our conversations. The fish was amazingly fresh, water was refilled before it was even half empty! little bite sizes of delicious uni filled my orifices with happiness.
author: Kristina L.

description: I'm sorry, but I live in monterey, where real sushi is made I guess. This place took forever, didn't have a big variety, and didn't even have full rolls. When is 5 pieces a full roll and at the same price? No bueno. I've had much better at an ayce in Vegas than here. Definitely a big disappointment because of all the good reviews. Ill stick to more modern sushi bars and ones that give great service.
author: Tiffany L.

description: This place is great. We came here on a Saturday night and there was a long wait that was most definitely worth it. The service was friendly and impeccable and the food was affordable and delicious. They have sake bombing which is a great time and the DJ is on-point.
author: Christine R.

description:
Would have liked this place a lot better last time if the waitress would not have been fllirting with my guy the whole night. It was making everything so awkward, she just kept coming back! We both tried to avoid conversation and eye contact, which kind of pissed her off. When it was time for the check she tossed it on the table right on top of our entwined hands and walked away.
Besides that the food was good as always and I will continue to go back.
author: Gina M.

description: I've been here once and I absolutely loved it and can't wait to go back! Super fresh sushi and a varied menu. Try the grilled mackerel appetizer, it's phenomenal! Cool place to hang out, awesome music, a little loud but a fun place all the same. Open late too if you're craving sushi late at night.
author: Sabina H.

description: Sushi was just okay in my book. The Rolls are actually fairly small and nothing out of the ordinary. Our Eel was a little on the fishy side. It was a Sunday night, so possibly an old shipment from the week? Good for a casual place, but not worth the 45 minute wait.
author: Taylor R.

description:
This place is fun and great. Somewhat crazy spot for a restaurant, but to an extent I liked the DJ more than I liked the food. I think the atmosphere makes this place.

We were enticed to go in by the funky 90s music, to see a full-blown Japanese restaurant with a DJ playing house, hip-hop, blah blah blah. Waiting for a table is a pain. I would say about 30 minutes. No less. Good thing that they have a full bar, though. 

The space is cramped, and I was irked on several occasions. We were seated right by the DJ, so anytime anyone needed to get to the tables behind us or go to the ladies' room upstairs, I got bumped, spilling my drink. Not one person apologized for violently bumping my chair. Kinda rude.

The sushi was good in flavor but really small in size, so it's a plus and a minus there. In the end, despite spending over $80 with my hubby on this dinner, we left somewhat hungry and ended up eating at a place next to our house.
author: Yelena K.

description:
I love Ryoko's. I have visited the restaurant so many times that the waitstaff recognize me and know me by name. Out of the many, many sushi places I have dined at Ryoko's remains my favorite. The volcano roll, which oddly combines peanut butter, jalepeños and shrimp tempura is magic.
